description: Rinse the chicken breast fillet under cold water and pat dry. Mix with soy sauce and pepper, place in a freezer bag and marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.

description: To poach the Benedict eggs, add salted water with white wine vinegar and a pinch of sugar to a large saucepan. Add bay leaf, black peppercorns and cloves into it. Bring the water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes.

title: Eggplant Rolls with Ground Lamb Filling
description: Peel the onion and garlic, and chop finely. Rinse, trim and chop the celery. Peel the carrot and cut into small cubes.

title: Leek and Ham Rolls
description: Rinse and trim the leeks and cook in salted water for 8-10 minutes until al dente. Remove and drain.

title: Lamb Stew with Artichoke Hearts
description: Rinse lamb under cold water, pat dry and cut into bite-sized pieces.

title: Sea Bream Parcels with Tomatoes and Fennel
description: Rinse the fennel, cut out core and remove outer layer. Remove stalks and fronds. Coarsely chop the fronds. Reserve the fennel bulb for later use. Peel the garlic and cut in half.

title: Asparagus in Ham with Egg Tartare
description: Hard boil 4 eggs in boiling water for 9-10 minutes.

title: Chicken Meatballs with Cucumber Salad
description: Rinse, trim and cut scallions crosswise into thin rings. Heat 1 tablespoon canola oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry scallions until translucent. Remove pan from heat and let cool.

title: Apricot Trifle with Nuts
description: Rinse the apricots, remove the pits and finely chop. Let simmer in a pot with a little water, then allow to cool.

title: Avocado Lime Soup with Ginger and Cilantro
description: Peel 1 onion, halve and fry cut surfaces in a large saucepan over medium heat for about 2-3 minutes.
types: ['fruit-vegetable', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo dinner', 'Paleo Main Dish', 'Paleo lunch', 'Paleo Soup', 'Paleo Appetizer', 'Healthy Eating', 'low-carb', 'low-carb lunch', 'low-carb fish', 'low-carb soup', 'Vegetable', 'Herb', 'Tropical Fruit', 'soup', 'Vegetable Soup']

title: Chicken with Chinese Cabbage
description: Cut cabbage into wide strips.

title: Frittata with Asparagus
description: Toast pumpkin seeds in dry pan until fragrant. Remove and let cool.

title: Egg Zucchini Frittata
description: Rinse zucchini and cut into small pieces or slices. Peel garlic and chop finely. Mix zucchini with thyme and garlic and fry in hot oil in a frying pan for 4-5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Pike Gratin
description: Season inside and out with salt and pepper. Place on an oiled baking sheet.

title: Cress and Broad Bean Salad
description: For the dressing, mix the oil with the vinegar and the vegetable broth.

title: Fried Cod with Artichokes and Sage
description: Serve this as a main course for a dinner with a side salad and/or bread on the side.

title: Turkey Goulash with Sauerkraut and Thyme
description: For the sauce: Meanwhile, rinse the pepper, halve lengthwise, remove the seeds and white ribs and cut into thin strips. Peel the onions and cut into strips.
types: ['Turkey', 'diet', 'Gluten-free', 'Gluten-free Dinner', 'Gluten-free Poultry Recipe', 'Gluten-free Lunch', '250-400 Calorie', 'low-carb', 'low-carb dinner', 'low-carb lunch', 'low-carb poultry', 'egg-free', 'food-combining', 'Food-Combining Dinner', 'Food-Combining Lunch', 'Ragout', 'Turkey Ragout', 'Szeged Goulash', 'skillet dish', 'Home Cooking', 'weekend cooking', 'Poultry', 'Vegetable', 'fruit-vegetable', 'Cabbage', 'Spices', 'Main Course']

title: Tofu with Mushroom Filling
description: Drizzle the tofu with 4 tablespoons soy sauce and let marinate for 30 minutes.

title: Fried Cod with Zucchini and Herb Pesto
description: Puree the cashews, scallions, chopped herbs, garlic and lime juice in a hand blender. Gradually blend in the  oil. Season with salt, pepper and cayenne pepper.

title: Pork Tenderloin and White Asparagus with Sage Breadcrumbs
description: Cut the pork into 12 medallions. Rinse the sage, pat dry and pluck the leaves. Melt 100 grams butter in a pan and saute the sage leaves until crispy. Remove from the pan and brown the breadcrumbs in the butter. Season with salt.

title: Crispy Stuffed Meat Patties
description: Combine the  bread, meat, egg, onion(approximately 14 ounces) and mustard and knead well. Season with salt and pepper and divide into 8 equal parts. Shape into uniform very flat patties. Place 1 tablespoon cream cheese in the center of each of four patties. Top with the remaining 4 patties, and press to enclose the filling. Dredge the meatballs in bread crumbs. Heat the butter in a large skillet and saute the patties over medium heat until golden brown and cooked through.

title: Puff Pastry Pie with Ground Meat
description: To prepare the pie, thaw the puff pastry and roll out on a floured surface. Keep ¼ of the rolled pastry dough aside. Roll out the rest and the line the baking dish with it. Fill with half of the ground meat mixture and place the peeled hardboiled egg lengthwise.

title: Salad with Roast Beef and Parmesan Crisps
description: Bake for about 5 minutes in a hot oven, watching continuously until the cheese is vigorously bubbling and lightly golden brown. Remove from the oven and let cool briefly on the sheet pan. Transfer to a wire rack and let cool until crispy.

title: Stuffed Perch Roll
description: Whisk quark with egg yolks, herbs and breadcrumbs. Spread mixture on fsh and roll up, twist foil at the ends well. Place into a steamer and cook over gently boiling water, covered, for about 12-15 minutes.

title: Italian Style Scrambled Eggs
description: Rinse and grate the zucchini.

title: Seared Octopus with Peppers and Pesto
description: Pull off the stove. In a separate skillet, heat the remaining olive oil. Sear the octopus on all sides, and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with lemon juice. To serve, arrange the octopus on plate with the pepper mixture. Garnish with pesto.

title: Mixed Salad with Blood Sausage
description: In another bowl, whisk together the vinegar, oil, 2 tablespoons of the pickle juice and mustard, season with salt and pepper and pour over the salad. Cover and let stand 45 minutes. Serve sprinkled with chives.

title: Mixed Grill
description: Heat the grill to medium and lightly oil the grates. Season the chicken, pork steak, pork roast and meat patties with pepper and place on the grill along with the ground meat patties and grill until golden brown on both sides, 5-8 minutes, season with salt.

title: Salmon with Hollandaise Sauce
description: Rinse the cucumber, cut in half lengthwise, scrape out seeds with a spoon, cut into thin slices and spread on plates like roof tiles.

title: Meatloaf
description: Rinse the pepper, halve lengthwise, remove the seeds and white ribs and chop finely. Peel and finely chop the onion, finely chop the sage.

title: Fillet of Beef with Radicchio Salad
description: For the pepper steak: Crush the peppercorns and allspice with a mortar and pestle. Sprinkle the pepper mixture on a board and turn the steaks in it, pressing firmly to adhere. Peel and quarter the garlic. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute until golden brown, remove. Place the steaks in the hot pan and sear, about 1 minute per side. Reduce the heat and cook 2 to 4 minutes per side to desired degree of doneness. Sprinkle the steaks with salt, remove from the pan and tent with aluminum foil to keep warm if not serving right away.

title: Almond Chicken
description: Peel and chop the garlic. Briefly fry in 1 tablespoon hot oil, then remove from pan. Puree the almonds and garlic, gradually adding the white bread, parsley, ginger and clove.

title: Greek Salad
description: Combine all the vegetables and mix with the olives. Transfer to plates.

title: Green Salad with Fried Chicken Breast
description: Rinse the mushrooms and cut into quarters. Rinse, trim and drain the watercress. Peel the eggs and cut into eighths.

title: Chicken with Vegetables
description: Saute onions and garlic for 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Add chicken and cook until opaque, then add peppers, snow peas, ginger and ground spices, stirring for 30 sec. Pour in chicken stock and cook on medium heat about 10 minutes. Simmer until the liquid almost completely evaporates. Season with salt, pepper, lemon juice and chile sauce, and garnish before serving with fresh coriander leaves.

title: Sour Soup with Egg
description: Cut the bacon into strips. Finely chop the cucumber.

title: Savory Egg Custard with Vegetables
description: In a bowl, whisk together 0.5 liter (approximately 2 cups) of the milk, the eggs, cheese and a little salt, pepper and nutmeg. Pour the egg mixture into the baking dish and set the dish in a larger baking dish. Pour boiling water to come halfway up the sides of the pan and bake the custard until set, about 30 minutes.

title: Melon Salad with Chicken Breast
description: Peel melon, cut in half, remove the seeds, cut into very thin slices and serve with the sliced ​​chicken breasts decoratively on plates.

title: Tofu with Rice and Green Beans
description: Cut the tofu into bite-sized pieces. Rinse the scallions and thinly slice. Peel and mince the garlic.

title: Roast Beef Cabbage Rolls
description: Distribute coleslaw on roast beef slices, roll up and place on a plate.

title: Stuffed Squid
description: Blanch the tomatoes in boiling water, shock in ice water, peel, quarter, core and dice finely. Rinse the peppers, remove the stems, seeds and pith and finely dice. Rinse the zucchini and finely dice. Peel the onions and garlic and finely chop. Sweat in 2 tablespoons oil and then add the zucchini, peppers and squid tentacles and simmer for 4 minutes. Add 1/2 of the tomatoes then remove the pan from the heat. Season with salt and pepper then stir in the chopped hard-boiled eggs and 1 raw egg.

title: Ham-Wrapped Monkfish with Mixed Vegetables
description: For the vegetables: Cut the peppers into quarters, remove stems, seeds and pith and cut the flesh into 1-1.5 cm (approximately 1/3-1/2 inch) diamonds. Rinse the tomatoes, cut into quarters, remove the stems and seeds and cut the flesh into diamonds. Trim the scallions and thinly slice. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and sauté the onions until translucent. Add the peppers and sauté briefly. Season with salt and pepper. Add the stock and simmer for 6-8 minutes. Add the tomatoes and herbs and simmer for another 2 minutes.

title: Belgian Endive with Goat Cheese Filling
description: Rinse peppers and cut into small cubes.

title: Sole Rolls with Leeks
description: Grdually add oil, whisking constantly, until mixture becomes thick and creamy.

title: Asparagus Salad with Strawberries
description: Rinse strawberries, trim and halve or quarter depending on size. Rinse sorrel and shake dry.

title: Filled Tomatoes
description: Scoop out seeds with a small spoon and arrange on paper towels, cut side down.

title: Stuffed Cod
description: For the stuffing: rinse and dry basil, pluck off leaves and combine with pine nuts, butter and egg yolk, mash well. Crumble bread over herb puree, add pecorino and season with salt and pepper. Spread stuffing on one fish fillet, top with second fillet and press lightly.

title: Pork Chops with Stir-Fried Vegetables
description: Rinse, trim and slice the radishes.

title: Grilled Lamb Cutlets
description: On the grill, cook the meat on each side for about 3-5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, sprinkle with chervil and serve.

title: Baked Fish Fillets with Tomatoes
description: Rinse and pat dry tomatoes, cut 2 tomatoes into thin slices. Halve the rest and remove seeds, chop.

title: Seafood Salad with Citrus Dressing
description: Rinse the bell pepper, remove the ribs and seeds and cut into thin strips.

title: Quick Beef Stew
description: Heat wine in a saucepan, add mushrooms and onions with marinade, add sour cream with herbs, lemon juice, bouillon cube and mustard, mix well and bring to a boil. Add beef stew and simmer on low heat for about 4-5 minutes. Pour into bowls and top with dollops of sour cream. Garnish with rosemary and serve.

title: Raspberry Vinegar
description: Let bottles stand until vinegar turns pink, approximately 14 days. Filter the raspberry vinegar through a fine sieve.

title: Calamari with Scallions
description: Boil the calamari in salted water and blanch. Rinse in cold water. Drain in a colander.

title: Spinach and Feta Pie
description: Melt butter gently. Whisk egg and add milk, stirring. Add butter and whisk well.

title: Chicken Breast on Vegetable Salad
description: Halve cucumber lengthwise, scrape out seeds with a teaspoon and cut crosswise in half slices.

title: Cheesey Brussels Sprouts Soup
description: Cook onion in butter until translucent. Add potatoes and Brussels sprouts. Cook briefly and then pour in broth. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 20 minutes. Remove a small portion of Brussels sprouts and purée remaining soup with an immersion blender. Place back in pot and bring to a boil again. Melt the grated Emmental in the soup. Stir in sour cream and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Add the reserved Brussels sprouts and allow to warm up again in soup. Pour soup into bowls and garnish with cheese balls. Serve immediately.
types: ['Vegetable Soup', 'Gluten-free', 'Gluten-free Vegetarian Recipe', 'Gluten-free Lunch', 'egg-free', 'meat-free', 'Vegetarian Lunch', 'Vegetarian Soups', 'Vegetarian Appetizers', 'Autumn', 'winter', 'Vegetable', 'Cabbage', 'Cheese', 'soup', 'Cheese Soup', 'low-carb']

title: Herb Salad with Edible Flowers
description: Whisk together the vinegar, mustard, sugar and corn oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Beef and Chicken with Vegetables and Broth
description: Melt butter in a saucepan and saute the shallots and garlic in it. Add the beef and soup vegetables, and fry briefly. Add the cloves and bay leaf, pour in the cattle or poultry broth, and bring to a boil. Cook covered over low heat for about 2 hours. Add the chicken drumsticks to beef and vegetables after 1½ hours.

title: Dried Beef with Peppers and Onions
description: Drain and pat dry well. Cut the meat into thin strips.

title: Squid and Tuna Sashimi
description: In a bowl, stir together the soy sauce and horseradish and serve with the sashimi.

title: Blackened Flounder
description: Rinse the fish and pat dry. Score 3-4 times, drizzle with lemon juice and brush with olive oil. Sprinkle the spice mixture over the fish and press lightly to secure.

title: Roast Chicken with Bell Peppers and Peperoncini
description: Peel the onions and cut into wedges.

title: Miso Soup with Tofu
description: Cut tofu into cubes.

title: Deep Fried Shrimp
description: Prepare fryer and heat to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Sausage Salad with Cucumbers and Tomatoes
description: To make dressing: Mix horseradish with salt and pepper to taste, vinegar and olive oil. Toss salad ingredients with dressing, let stand briefly, and serve sprinkled with cress.

title: Creamy Herb Cucumber Snacks
description: Chop herbs roughly and puree with the cream with an immersion blender.

title: Vegetable Omelet
description: Heat olive oil in a nonstick pan and sauté peppers, onions and garlic, stirring constantly. Add tomatoes and season with salt, pepper and thyme. Sauté briefly.

title: Zander with Beets
description: Rinse watercress, shake dry.

title: Fish Soup
description: For the soup, core the pepper halves, rinse and cut into small cubes. Rinse the fish fillets and cut into bite-sized pieces. Add with the peppers into the fish stocks and cook 3-4 minutes.

title: Vegetable Tagine with Chicken Breast
description: In an open tagine, heat olive oil and brown the chicken briefly. Add the onion, zucchini, beans, and mushrooms and cook briefly. Add the tomatoes, garlic, bay leaf, and broth. Season with salt, pepper, and coriander. Reduce the heat, cover the tagine and simmer for 20 minutes. Rinse the mint, pat dry, and chop the leaves very finely. To serve, remove the tagine from the heat and garnish with fresh mint.

title: Vegetable Gratin with Sausages
description: Add sausages and cheese to vegetables and spread in a greased baking dish.

title: Asparagus and Carrot Salad with Shrimp
description: To make dressing, whisk salt and pepper to taste with vinegar and 4 tablespoons oil. Pour dressing over asparagus and carrots and toss to coat. Stir in chives. Cover and let marinate about 15 minutes.

title: Scallops with Truffle Sauce
description: Drizzle the flesh and Corail with lemon juice and season lightly with salt and pepper.

title: Fish Cutlets in Tomato Sauce
description: Blanch tomatoes in hot water for a few seconds, rinse in cold water and peel. Quarter and remove seeds, cut into small cubes.
types: ['saltwater\xa0Fish', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo dinner', 'Paleo Main Dish', 'Paleo lunch', 'African', 'Cooking on vacation', 'Fish', 'Meat', 'low-carb']

title: Monkfish Cutlets with Tomatoes
description: Whisk eggs with cheese and herbs. Dip fish into egg mixture.

title: Turbot Rolls with Smoked Salmon Filling
description: Rinse the parsley, shake dry, pluck the leaves and finely chop. Mix the chopped parsley with the shallots.

title: Herb Butter
description: Rinse and finely chop the chives and the parsley. Add to the butter. Peel the garlic and pass throough a press. Add the butter-herb mixture, the garlic, and half a teaspoon of salt to the food processor. Mix until thoroughly combined.

title: Fried Fish with Pesto
description: Rinse fish, pat dry and cut into strips. Season with salt and pepper and coat with flour. Heat oil in a deep pan and cook fish, few pieces at a time, for about 3-4 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and arrange on plates. Garnish with pesto and lemon wedges, serve.

title: Turkey Escalope with Bell Peppers
description: Rinse, halve and trim the bell peppers and cut into strips. Sauté in some oil for 3-4 minutes.

title: Tuna and Avocado Salad
description: In a bowl, blend the lemon juice with the vinegar, 4 tablespoons of oil and sugar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle the dressing over the salads.

title: Pork with a Vegetable Filling
description: Cut a piece of aluminum foil (large enough to wrap around the pork) and cover with a sheet of plastic wrap in the same size. Brush with remaining oil and sprinkle with parsley. Then place pork in center and wrap tightly. Seal well. Poach in hot water, about 80°C (approximately 175°F), for 30 minutes, longer or shorter as needed.

title: Zucchini Rolls with Soft Cheese Filling
description: Garnish with olives and nuts and serve.

title: Stir Fried Chicken with Peanuts
description: Peel the ginger and finely chop. Cut the red chile pepper (with gloves) into rings. Rinse, trim and cut the scallions diagonally into 4 cm (approximately 1½ inch) long pieces.

title: Beef Steaks with Guacamole
description: For the beef steaks: peel onion and chop finely. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan and saute onion until translucent. Cool slightly and mix together with egg and thyme. Add to meat and season with salt and pepper and add enough breadcrumbs to make malleable mixture. Shape into four patties.

title: Gnocchetti Pasta with Zucchini
description: Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Marinated Steak
description: Heat the grill, then add the steaks. Cook 2-5 minutes on each side, depending on your desired degree of doneness. Remove from the grill, wrap in aluminum foil, and let rest for 5 minutes. Arrange the steaks on plates, season with some of the coarse salt, and serve with mixed vegetables if you'd like.

title: Poultry Meatballs
description: Serve to taste on skewers and with dip.

title: Salad with Chicken and Pine Nuts
description: Rinse the chicken breasts and pat dry. Brush them with a little oil and season with salt and pepper. Broil on both sides for about 6–8 minutes.

title: Peppercorn and Mustard Crusted Pork Tenderloin
description: Grind the peppercorns with the mustard, olive oil and salt in a mortar.

title: Beef and Vegetable Soup
description: For the soup, rinse the boiled beef with cold water and place into another pot. Pour in the cold water and season with salt. Add the peeled garlic and onion, cloves and bay leaf. Bring to a boil and leave to simmer just below the boiling point evenly for 2-2½ hours. Skim off any resulting foam from the surface.

title: Duck Breast with Mushrooms
description: Rinse the duck breasts and pat dry. Diamond cut the skin side. Heat the oil in a pan, add the meat with the skin side down. Cook about 6 minutes over low heat until crispy. Turn and cook another 2 minutes. Place in an ovenproof baking dish and bake 45-55 minutes.

title: Fish Rillette
description: Serve with toast.

title: Mixed Salad with Smoked Salmon
description: For the dressing, mix the vinegar, 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, the mustard, the oil, the sugar and the chives and season with salt and pepper.

title: Creamy Chicken Curry Soup
description: Remove the chicken and chop the meat into small pieces. Pour the broth through a sieve, catching 1 liter (approximately 4.25 cups).

title: Mediterranean Mackerel
description: Rinse tomatoes. Drain olives. Peel and coarsely chop garlic. Rinse cilantro, shake dry, strip leaves from stems and chop coarsely. Mix cilantro with garlic, oil and lemon juice. Brush some of the cilantro-oil in 4 ovenproof serving ramekins.

title: Toast with Scrambled Eggs and Oyster Mushrooms
description: Brush the bread slices with the butter, then top with the scrambled eggs and the mushrooms.

title: Marinated Shrimp in Parmesan Bowls
description: Sprinkle the grated parmesan onto the prepared baking sheet in a circle about 10-12 cm (approximately 4-5 inches) in diameter. Bake in the preheated oven for about 5 minutes, until the cheese is golden brown. Remove from the oven, carefully remove the cheese circle with a spatula and place over an upside down bowl or muffin tin. Press lightly and allow to cool.

title: Stir-Fry Beef with Mushrooms
description: Heat oil in a wok or pan. Brown meat, add ginger, mushrooms and zucchini and saute, stirring, for about 5 minutes.
types: ['Beef', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo dinner', 'Paleo Main Dish', 'Paleo lunch', 'skillet dish', 'Meat', 'Herb', 'mushroom', 'low-carb']

title: Mediterranean Pork Loin
description: For the pork loin: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Dill Pesto
description: The dill pesto goes best with fish and mild cheeses.

title: Sesame Meatballs
description: Rinse 1/2 the sage leaves, pat dry and very finely chop. Squeeze the excess moisture from the bread and mix with 1 egg, the sesame seeds, meat and chopped sage. Season with salt and pepper and then form into walnut-sized meatballs. Dip the meatballs in the remaining beaten egg and then coat in the combined flour and breadcrumbs.

title: Beef Fillets with Crab Sauce and Asparagus
description: For the asparagus, peel asparagus stem ends slightly. Stir sugar, salt and lemon into water in a wide pot and bring to a boil. Add asparagus to pot and let simmer 5-10 minutes.

title: Smoked Steelhead Trout with Tomato Sauce
description: Place wood shavings or chips in an old wok or large pan. Then set a sieve or smoker insert over the chips, about 3 cm (approximately 1 inch) above the chips. Cover the sieve with aluminum foil and brush with olive oil. Rinse the fish, pat dry and place on the foil with the oil. Cover the wok. Cook over high heat on an outdoor barbecue grill about 10 minutes, then turn down the temperature and cook for about 5 minutes. Open the wok periodically (it is recommended to cook this outdoors on the grill, because it has a strong smell!) and check whether the fish is done.

title: Baked Pork Medallions
description: Rinse pork fillet, pat dry and cut into 8 approximately equal slices. Season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a pan and sear on both sides. Remove from pan and place on a lined with parchment paper baking sheet. Spread with cracker mixture and bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 10-15 minutes.

title: Chicken Skewers with Tomatoes
description: For the chicken skewers: rinse herbs, shake dry and chop finely. Rinse chicken breasts, pat dry and cut into 2 cm (approximately 3/4 inch) cubes. Rinse tomatoes and thread chicken and tomatoes, alternating, on wooden skewers. Heat olive oil in a pan and add herbs, cook skewers for about 7-9 minutes, turning often. Arrange skewers on plates and serve accompanied by tomato dip.

title: Paprika Chicken
description: Rinse and dry the chicken. Cut into quarters with a poultry shears. Season generously with salt, pepper, and paprika. Put the chicken in a roasting pan with the oil and cook 45–50 minutes in the oven. Brush the chicken with honey 20 minutes before end of cooking. For a crispy crust, increase the oven temperature somewhat. and turn on the broiler.

title: Garlic Chicken
description: Rinse garlic cloves, halve crosswise and press. Rinse rosemary, pat dry and finely chop individual pieces in half. Mix 2 tablespoons olive oil with the chopped garlic, chopped rosemary and paprika. Rinse chicken inside and out, pat dry, salt and pepper and rub with marinade.

title: Fruit Salad with Goats Cheese
description: Rinse the blueberries and pat dry. Set about half aside for the garnish and purée the rest with the olive oil, vinegar and honey. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Sausages and Sauerkraut
description: Heat the remaining lard in a skillet, add the sausages and cook, turning them as they brown, until crispy and cooked through. Remove the spice bag, and season the sauekraut with salt if necessary.

title: Seafood Skewer with Pesto
description: For the pesto: Toast the pine nuts until golden brown in a dry frying pan. Let cool. Pluck the basil leaves, rinse, pat dry and place in a blender. Add the peeled garlic and pine nuts and blend until smooth. With the motor running, slowly drizzle in the olive oil and blend until creamy.

title: Oysters with Bacon
description: Rinse oysters under running water and open with oyster knife. Line top rack of grill with parchment paper and arrange oysters. Dice bacon and distribute over the oysters. Season with sea salt and tumeric.  Grill until the bacon is crispy (about 5 minutes). Remove oysters from grill, sprinkle with lemon juice and serve.

title: Salad with Mushrooms and Salmon
description: Wipe mushrooms clean with a paper towel and cut into quarters. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and sauté, stirring, about 5 minutes. While cooking, season mushrooms with salt and pepper and add 1 tablespoon each lemon juice and balsamic vinegar. Remove mushrooms and cooking liquid from pan and let cool. Wipe pan clean with a paper towel and add remaining oil. Add salmon to pan and sauté over high heat, about 2 minutes per side. Season with salt and pepper. Remove salmon from pan and let cool. Flake fish with a fork into smaller pieces and mix with mushrooms and salad. Whisk remaining lemon juice and vinegar and drizzle over salad. To serve, season salad with salt and pepper.

title: Baked Goat Cheese
description: Cut 4 pieces of parchment paper into about 30 x 30 cm (approximately 12 x 12 inch) pieces.

title: Tomato-Mozzarella Salad with Olives
description: Drain the olives and capers. Cut olives into rings.

title: Grilled Chicken Legs with Bacon
description: Rinse the chicken legs and pat dry. Mix the oil with the orange juice, the rose and sweet paprikas, and season with salt and pepper. Brush the legs with sauce and wrap each with a slice of bacon. Cook on the grill on all sides for 6-8 minutes.

title: Beer Can Chicken
description: Rinse the chicken and pat dry. Mince the garlic and mix with the thyme, paprika, salt, pepper, canola oil and about 80 ml (approximately 1/3 cup) of the beer. Wrap the beer can in aluminum foil and place on a beer can chicken rack (optional). Rub the marinade onto the chicken, under the skin and inside the cavity. Place the chicken onto the beer can and transfer to the preheated grill. Close the lid and cook for about 50 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 75°C (approximately 165°F).

title: Three Dips for Vegetables
description: For the cheese dip: Mash the camembert with a fork and mix with the cream cheese, paprika and ground caraway seeds, season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with caraway seeds and a little paprika.

title: Herb Trout
description: Rinse fish and pat dry. Brush with oil, drizzle with orange juice, and season with salt and pepper insude and out. Stuff with about half of garlic, orange peel and herbs. Arrange remaining herbs, orange peel and garlic slices on fish and tie with kitchen twine. Sprinkle with fennel seeds. Sprinkle four small baking dishes (or one large) with salt and arrange fish on top. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 25 minutes. Cool slightly and serve.

title: Mackerel with Tomatoes
description: Preheat oven to 200°C convection (approximately 400°F). Brush a baking dish with a little oil. Rinse fish and pat dry. Season with salt and pepper and place fish in the baking dish. Pour wine over fish, and distribute tomatoes, shallots, garlic, olives and bay leaf over fish. Bake about 20 minutes. Let cool briefly, top with dill flowers and serve.

title: Meatballs
description: Rinse the herbs, shake dry and finely chop. Peel the carrot and finely grate. Peel the onion and garlic, and finely dice. Rinse the chile pepper, trim and chop small. Sweat the onion, garlic and chile in 1 tablespoon hot oil until tender. Add the grated carrot and sauté briefly. Mix the onion mixture with the well squeezed bread, ground meat, egg yolk, orange zest, the herbs and season with salt and pepper. Knead until mixture is smooth.

title: Chicken Breast with Berry Sauce
description: Rinse the chicken breasts, pat dry, and season with a little salt and pepper. Lightly coat with flour, shake off the excess, and sear the chicken in a pan for about 2 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Add the pine nuts and sauté briefly until they are golden.

title: Bell Peppers Stuffed with Zucchini, Olives and Feta
description: For the bell peppers, rinse the bell peppers, cut in half lengthwise, and remove seeds and ribs. Rinse the zucchini, trim, cut in half lengthwise and cut into slices. Rinse and halve the cherry tomatoes. Peel, halve and cut the red onion into strips. Crumble the feta. Cut the olives into slices. Mix the olives with feta, onion, cherry tomatoes and zucchini, and stuff into the bell pepper halves. Top the stuffed bell pepper halves with the pesto and serve garnished with basil.

title: Spinach, Feta and Pine Nut Filled Meatloaf
description: Rinse the spinach and blanch in a pot of boiling salted water until wilted. Drain, rinse with cold water, squeeze well and chop coarsely. Tear the rolls into pieces and soak in lukewarm water.

title: Meatballs
description: Peel the onion and garlic, finely chop and saute in a pan in hot oil until translucent. Remove from heat and let cool. Rinse thyme, shake dry and remove the leaves. Mix the ground meat with the onion and garlic mixture, the egg, the well squeezed bread, mustard and thyme and season with salt and pepper. Divide the meat mixture into two bowls. Mix the drained corn in one half and crumble the feta cheese in the other. Mix both well and shape into small meatballs. Saute in hot clarified butter 6-8 minutes until golden brown. Drain on paper towels, place in small bowls and garnish with the remaining thyme. Serve with vegetable puree and ketchup, if desired.

title: Carrot Puree and Ground Meat Turrets
description: For the meat mixture: clean mushrooms and cut into small pieces. Heat oil in a saucepan and saute meat for about 5-7 minutes on high heat. Add mushrooms and remaining white scallion rings and season well with salt and pepper. Place 4 tartlet rings (8-10 cm in diameter) (approximately 3-4 inches) on plates and layer carrot puree and meat mixture, alternating (starting and finishing with carrot puree) in the rings. Carefully remove rings and garnish with chives. Serve.

title: Roasted Lamb Chops
description: Rinse lamb and slice into 4 chops. Peel and press garlic through a garlic press. Rinse rosemary, pat dry and combine with olive oil and garlic in an ovenproof dish. Place lamb chops in dish and roast, turning occasionally and basting with pan juices, about 25 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Sausage and Apple Wrapped in Bacon
description: In the meantime, rinse the apples, quarter, and cut out the core. Cut the fried sausages in half and wrap along with an apple quarter in a slice of bacon.

title: Vinaigrette
description: Gather all of the ingredients for the vinaigrette.

title: Vinaigrette
description: Gather and measure all of the ingredients.

title: Grilled Pork Medallions
description: Brush grill pan or grill with a little oil and grill medallions (on the bottom side) for about 4 minutes or until cheese is slightly melted. Turn over and grill for 4 minutes more. Remove meat from the grill and let rest briefly.

title: Baked Fish
description: Rinse fish fillets and pat dry. Place each fillet on a piece of parchment paper that is about 30x30 cm (approximately 12x12 inches). Rinse parsley, shake dry, pluck leaves from stem and chop coarsely. Sprinkle fish lightly with balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Brush each fillet with a little olive oil and sprinkle parsley over fish. Rinse tomatoes, place on fillets (remove vine) and season lightly with salt and pepper. Fold the parchment paper into a packet around fish and tie with kitchen twine (or secure with toothpicks). Place fish packets on a baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes.

title: Baked Red Mullet
description: Rinse the fish, pat dry, drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Wrap the sliced ham around the fish and place in a well-oiled baking dish.

title: Grilled Lamb with Tomatoes
description: Peel shallot and chop finely. Heat remaining oil in a pan and saute shallot until translucent. Add honey and tomato juice. Bring to a boil. Chop sun-dried tomatoes finely and add to the pan. Simmer for about 15 minutes on low heat. Add rosemary and season with lemon juice, salt and cayenne pepper.

title: Grilled Ham with White Beans
description: Cut the ham into thick slices and grill on a well-oiled, preheated grill for about 5 minutes on each side.

title: Tomatoes Stuffed with Ground Meat
description: Peel shallot and garlic and chop finely. Combine with ground meat and add egg and breadcrumbs, mix until smooth. Season with oregano, salt and cayenne pepper and stuff tomatoes with the mixture.

title: Baked Salmon with Prawn Salad
description: For the salad, rinse the fennel bulb, trim, cut out the hard stalk, and cut into thin strips. Rinse the cucumber, trim the ends and cut into slices. Rinse the dill and cilantro, shake dry, pluck the leaves and chop. Mix the dill and cilantro with the fennel, cucumber slices, remaining olive oil, white balsamic vinegar and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Salad with Salmon
description: Heat the oil in a pan and put the salmon. Add the peas, pour in the white wine and cook everything at low temperature for about 8 minutes. Flip the salmon. Remove the pan from the heat and remove the salmon. Stir in the yogurt with the white wine and season the sauce with salt, pepper and lemon juice. Cut the salmon into pieces and spread over the salad. Pour the sauce on top and serve the salad.

title: Savory Coconut Smoothie
description: Peel cucumber, halve lengthwise, remove seeds and finely dice. Freeze about 20 minutes.

title: Lobster with Sherry Sauce
description: For the sauce, peel the onion and chop finely. Heat 50 grams (approximately 3¼ tablespoons) butter in a pan, stir in the flour and pour in the sherry and cream. Simmer until slightly creamy with stirring for about 5 minutes. Strain the sauce, if desired, through a sieve. Sprinkle the strained sauce with the chives and season with salt and pepper.

title: Mediterranean Tuna Salad
description: Mix the yogurt with the mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in all prepared salad ingredients and season with cayenne pepper, lemon juice and salt.
types: ['salad', 'Gluten-free', 'Gluten-free Dinner', 'Gluten-free Fish Recipe', 'Gluten-free Lunch', 'non-alcoholic', 'Pescetarian', 'food-combining', 'Food-Combining Dinner', 'Food-Combining Lunch', 'European', 'Mediterranean', 'Spanish', 'Summer Salad', 'Cooking on vacation', 'Fish', 'saltwater\xa0Fish', 'leafy green vegetable', 'fruit-vegetable', 'Fresh Salad', 'Hearty Salad', 'Salad Dressing', 'low-carb']

title: Fillet of Beef with Tomatoes and Herbed Breadcrumbs
description: Rinse the tomatoes and drain. Rinse the thyme and pluck off the leaves. Coarsely grind the peppercorns in a mortar. Peel the shallot and chop finely. Rinse the chile, slit lengthwise, remove the seeds and white ribs and  finely chop. Finely grate the bread on a box grater or swap in 80 grams (approximately 2/3 cup) of bread crumbs.

title: Marinated Peppers
description: Remove peppers from the oven, place a wet paper towel over peppers and cool. Peel skin with a sharp knife and cut peppers into bite-sized pieces.

title: Baked Chicken Breast Fillets with Peppers and Mozzarella
description: Rinse and dry bell peppers, halve and remove seeds and ribs. Arrange on a baking sheet, skin side up, and roast in preheated oven at 220°C (approximately 425°F) for about 10-15 minutes or until peppers blacken and blister. Remove from the oven and cover with a damp kitchen towel. Cool for 5 minutes and peel.

title: Marinade for Grilled Meats
description: This marinade is great for grilled meats. Brush the meat (such as steaks) with the marinade. Wrap the meat in aluminum foil, or cover with plastic wrap in a bowl. Marinate for at least 4 hours in the refrigerator, but it's better if overnight. Remove the meat from the marinade, and drain thoroughly. Season with a little salt and cook on a hot grill.

title: Chicken-Asparagus Soup
description: Heat oil in a pan, add the onion, garlic and the chile pepper and sauté until translucent. Pour in the broth and the asparagus and cook for about 6 minutes.

title: Ham Jelly with Asparagus
description: Rinse the white and the green asparagus. Peel the white asparagus whole, while peel the green asparagus up to just the lower third. Trim the woody ends. Tie the asparagus with kitchen string into bundles. Cook the white asparagus for 15-20 minutes, while the green asparagus for about 8 minutes in the ham broth. Take out both the asparagus from ham broth, rinse with cold water and cut into small pieces.

title: Fish Curry
description: Rinse the cabbage, trim, remove the tough core and cut the cabbage into pieces. Sauté briefly in a saucepan in 1 tablespoon oil. Season with salt and pepper, pour in a little water, cover and cook until al dente, about 10 minutes.

title: Fish Au Gratin with Almonds
description: Rinse the fish fillets, pat dry and place on the baking sheet. Season with a bit of lemon juice and a little salt and pepper. Crush the sliced almonds with a rolling pin. Mix the ground almonds with the egg yolks, the dried sage and lemon zest and season with salt, pepper and the remaining lemon juice. Spread the mixture on the fish fillets and sprinkle the crushed sliced almonds on it. Bake in the oven for about 20 minutes.
types: ['Fish', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo dinner', 'Paleo Main Dish', 'Paleo lunch', 'Roast', 'baked dish', 'Christmas', 'festively', 'low-carb']

title: Vegetable Towers
description: Rinse, shake dry, and finely chop the oregano. Combine the oregano with the almonds, 2 tablespoons Parmesan, the lemon juice and 2 tablespoons of oil in a food processor. Season the pesto with salt and pepper.

title: Tomato Leek Soup
description: Saute the onion, garlic and chile pepper in 2 tablespoons of hot oil. Add the tomatoes. Pour in the broth. Add about 150 ml (approximately 1/2 cup) of cream. Simmer for 10-15 minutes.

title: Tuna and Avocado Salad on Crackers
description: To serve, top each cracker with 2-3 tablespoons of the avocado and tuna mixture. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and chives and top each with approximately 2 teaspoons caviar.

title: Pork Cutlets
description: Peel garlic and cut in half. Stir with red pepper flakes, cumin, honey, soy sauce, lemon juice and oil. Pour over chops, stir to coat and marinate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.

title: Herb-Coated Roast Leg of Lamb with Vegetables
description: Rinse the rosemary, pluck the needles and chop finely. Stir together 1 tablespoon rosemary and 2 tablespoons of oil, add to vegetables, season with salt and pepper and toss to coat.
types: ['Lamb', 'Meat', 'hearty side dish', 'Roast', 'baked dish', 'cooking for one', 'Home Cooking', 'European', 'Mediterranean', 'low-carb']

title: Chili Oil
description: Pass the oil through a fine strainer into a clean jar or bottle and seal tightly.

title: Tofu with Mediterranean Vegetables
description: Rinse zucchini, drain and cut in half lengthwise and cut into slices. Remove tofu from marinade. Heat remaining oil in a large, non-stick pan. Fry tofu and zucchini slices for about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Almond Soup
description: Boil the almonds in water. Remove the kernels from the shells and pat dry.

title: Arugula Soup
description: Peel and finely chop the onion and garlic. Heat the oil and saute the onion and garlic until translucent. Pour in the vegetable stock and simmer for about 10 minutes. Rinse the arugula and dill, remove the hard stems, spin dry and set some of each aside for the garnish. Chop the remaining arugula and dill.

title: Oven-baked Egg with Spinach
description: Preheat oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). With scissors, cut 4 pieces of parchment paper, each about 15 x 15 cm (approximately 6 x 6 inches) and press into cups of muffin tin. Season spinach with salt, pepper and nutmeg and place in parchment cups. For each, pour a beaten egg over spinach. Bake for about 15 minutes until eggs are done. Lift out parchment paper cup and season with salt and serve.
types: ['leafy green vegetable', 'Baking', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo breakfast', 'Paleo Snack', 'baked dish', 'French', 'Eggs', 'Vegetable', 'low-carb']

title: Frittata with Savoy Cabbage and Ham
description: Heat oil in a large frying pan. Add onion and sauté until translucent. Add cabbage and cook, stirring, about 5 minutes. Pour egg-cream mixture over vegetables and mix well. Cook over low heat until eggs are set, 10-15 minutes.

title: Roast Beef
description: Rinse roast and pat dry. Peel onions and garlic and finely chop. Rinse tomatoes, cut away stalks, blanch, rinse, peel and dice. Season meat with salt and pepper and cook until brown in a roasting pan in hot oil. Remove roast and add onions and garlic. Saute for 2-3 minutes. Add tomato paste and pour in wine. Add half of the broth, diced tomatoes and apricots. Add roast again, cover and roast in oven for 5 hours. Turn roast as needed and add more broth as needed..

title: Mullet with Grilled Vegetables
description: Preheat the grill.

title: Red Sauce with Ground Meat
description: Peel onion and garlic and chop finely. Peel carrot and cut into very small cubes. Rinse celery, drain and pat dry and cut into very small cubes. Heat oil in a saucepan and sauté diced tomatoes.

title: Beef Steak with Chimichurri Sauce
description: Rinse beef fillet, pat dry and cut into 8 slices. Brush with remaining oil and cook on a hot grill, turning occasionally, 4-10 minutes (depending on the desired degree of doneness).

title: Cajun Salad
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Roast Pork Loin with Balsamic Strawberry Sauce
description: Rinse the pork loin and pat dry. Season with salt and pepper. In a skillet, heat the oil and sear the pork on all sides. Transfer to a roasting pan and roast for about 50 minutes. During the last 20 minutes of roasting time, baste with the butter and sprinkle with the almonds.

title: Chicken Wrapped in Bacon, Scallions and Tomatoes
description: Preheat oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Peppercorn-Crusted Steaks with Asparagus
description: For the steaks: Rinse steaks and pat dry. Coarsley grind the peppercorns and coriander with a mortar and pestle. Rub the steaks with the peppercorn mixture and season with salt to taste.

title: Poached Salmon
description: For the sauce, peel the shallot and chop finely. Sauté in the butter until translucent. Deglaze with the remaining wine and the fish stock. Simmer 2-3 minutes, then add the cream and simmer briefly. Blend finely with an immersion blender. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Stir-fry with Sprouts and Mushrooms
description: In a heavy skillet, heat oil and brown meat briefly. Add carrots and onions and fry for about 1-2 minutes until onions are translucent, while stirring. Add peppers, mushrooms, scallions and sprouts and stir in rice wine and soy sauce and cook together for about 2-3 minutes, until vegetables are al dente, stirring frequently.

title: Salad with Chicken, Watercress and Walnuts
description: Rinse, clean and spin dry watercress. Chop walnuts coarsely. Arrange all prepared salad ingredients decoratively on plates.

title: Peanut Chicken on Arugula Salad
description: Rinse arugula, trim and spin dry. Rinse and halve the tomatoes. Arrange tomatoes with the arugula on plates and sprinkle with the peanuts.

title: Shrimp Omelet
description: Heat a little oil in a frying pan, pour in 1/2 the egg mixture and stir until the eggs start to set. Stop stirring and cook, undisturbed, for 3-4 minutes over low heat. Sprinkle 1/2 the shrimp over the omelet then carefully fold up and arrange on a serving plate. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.

title: Peppers Stuffed with Feta
description: Rinse lettuce leaves and shake dry. Peel garlic and mash with a pinch of salt. Rinse basil, shake dry, pluck off leaves and chop finely. Add basil, chives and garlic to cheese. Season with lemon juice, salt and pepper.

title: Vegetable Salad with Zucchini, Tomato and Mint
description: Arrange all prepared salad ingredients decoratively on plates. Mix vinegar in a bowl with sugar and oil and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle vinegar mixture over the salad and serve sprinkled with sunflower seeds.

title: Grilled Salmon on Cedar Plank
description: Rinse the scallions, trim and thinly slice. Peel the shallots and garlic, chop the garlic finely and thinly slice the shallots. Rinse the dill, shake dry and finely chop. Combine the scallions, shallots, garlic and dill in a shallow dish along with the lime juice, maple syrup and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Chicken with Crawfish
description: Place the crawfish in plenty of boiling salted water. Reduce heat and let simmer for about 10 minutes. Drain.

title: Chicken and Pepper Salad
description: Preheat the oven broiler.

title: Grilled Beef Skewers with Satay Sauce
description: For the sauce: Toast the peanuts in a dry frying pan, let cool then finely crush in a mortar. In a saucepan, bring the coconut milk, peanut butter and curry to a boil. Stir in the crushed peanuts, lemon zest and lemon juice and boil, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes, until creamy. Let cool then pour into serving bowls and garnish with red pepper flakes.

title: Fennel Salad with Chicken
description: Rinse chicken, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a nonstick pan and cook chicken until golden brown on both sides. Rinse apples, quarter and core, slice. Add to the pan and cook until golden brown. Deglaze pan with a little water and simmer for about 5 minutes or until done and almost all liquid has evaporated. Turn chicken over occasionally.

title: Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce
description: For the peanut sauce: Toast the peanuts in a dry frying pan until golden brown, let cool then chop coarsely. Bring the coconut milk, peanut butter and curry to a boil, add the chopped peanuts, lemon zest and lemon juice and boil for about 5 minutes until creamy. Let cool.

title: Goat with Herbs
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F) upper and lower heat.

title: Pan-Fried Trout
description: In a pan, heat oil and butter over low heat. Fry trout until golden-brown, spooning fat over the fish occasionally, 6-8 minutes. Flip fish with a spatula and fry until golden-brown on second side, 6-8 minutes more. To check if the fish is cooked, pull on the dorsal fin. If it can be wiggled easily, the fish is done.

title: Sea Bass Parcels with Herbs
description: Place 4 pieces of baking paper (rectangular, about 20 x 40 cm) (rectangular, approximately 8 x 16 inches) on the work surface. Sprinkle the baking papers with olive oil. Season the sea bass fillets with salt and pepper, and place in the middle of each paper. Top the fillet with half of the herbs and lemon slices.

title: Broiled Trout
description: Rinse trout thoroughly inside and outside. Pat dry with paper towels. Season inside and outside of trout with salt and pepper. Cut lemon into thin slices and stuff cavity of each fish with 2-3 slices. Stuff each fish with two rosemary sprigs and 2 thyme sprigs.

title: Tomato and Mozzarella Salad with Peaches
description: For the vinaigrette, mix the oil with the vinegar. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Vegetable Gratin
description: Peel carrots and cut diagonally into large slices. Trim zucchini ends and cut zucchini into 3-4 mm (approximately 1/5inch) thick slices. Separate broccoli florets and peel stem, cut into pieces.

title: Poached Fish Dumplings
description: Bring the fish stock to just below a boil. Using two tablespoons, shape the mixture into ovals and slide into the stock. Dip the spoons in cold water each time before shaping. Poach 5-10 minutes.

title: Greek Lamb Skewers
description: For the marinade, peel the garlic and slice thinly. Whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, oregano and garlic. Season with sea salt and pepper and drizzle over the skewers.

title: Garlic Bread
description: Cut the baguette into slices. Brush the slices on both side with the butter and place on a wire rack. Broil on one side for 1-1.5 minutes until golden brown. Turn the slices, and broil until golden brown.

title: Baked Fish and Vegetables
description: Rinse and chop cabbage. Rinse, dry and cut scallions diagonally into rings. Peel ginger and cut into thin slices. Cut lemon into slices.

title: Grilled Turkey Roulades with Peppers
description: Rinse and halve peppers, remove seeds and ribs and cut into strips. Rinse zucchini, halve lengthwise, remove seeds and cut into narrow strips. Arrange peppers and zucchini strips on cutlets and roll up roulades, secure with toothpicks.

title: Pork Tenderloin with Pesto
description: For the pesto, rinse parsley, shake dry, pluck leaves and puree with remaining oil and Parmesan using an immersion blender. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Stuffed Turkey Roulade with Peas and Cream Cheese
description: Rinse turkey breast, pat dry, place between two sheets of plastic wrap and flatten with a meat tenderizer.

title: Deviled Eggs with Three Fillings
description: For the beet filling: Chop the beet very fine and mix into one of the bowls of chopped yolk mixture along with the cream cheese and the thyme. Season to taste with horseradish and salt. Spoon this mixture into 2 eggs. Garnish with chervil, pink peppercorns, and lemon wedges.

title: Chicken and Fish Skewers
description: For the fish skewers, rinse the tuna and pat dry and cut into pieces. Trim, rinse and slice the zucchini. Alternately stick zucchini with the fish and the bay leaves on skewers. Mix the oil with the lemon zest and fennel and brush on the skewers.

title: Spicy Souffle with Cheese
description: Step 2:

title: Mustard Sauce with Scallion and Tomato
description: Puree the sauce with half of the diced tomato. Stir in the cream and mustard. If the sauce is too thick, thin with a little broth. If the sauce is too thin, simmer a few minutes until reduced. Season to taste with salt and cayenne pepper. Garnish with the remaining tomatoes and scallions.

title: Grilled Salmon with Fruity Sauce
description: For the strawberry-rhubarb sauce, rinse, trim and peel the strawberries and rhubarb. Cut the strawberries in half and the rhubarb into pieces.

title: Turkey Roulades with Cherry Tomatoes
description: Rinse the turkey cutlets and pat dry with kitchen paper. Flatten with a meat tenderizer.

title: Greek Salad
description: For the dressing: Whisk vinegar with lemon juice, oregano, and sugar. Season with salt and pepper and whisk in oil until emulsified. Pour dressing over salad, toss to combine, season to taste and serve.

title: Vegetable Salad with Watercress
description: Combine the vinegar with the lemon juice and honey and mix well. Season with salt, pepper and red pepper flakes and mix into the vegetables. Cover and leave to marinate for about 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
types: ['Vegetable Salad', 'Summer Salad', 'In a jar', 'Salad in a Jar', 'Picnic', 'Vegetable', 'low-carb']

title: Juicy Chicken Legs with Herb Sauce
description: Rinse chicken legs, pat dry and remove skin. Add chicken to pot, reduce heat and poach about 40 minutes in barely simmering water.

title: Sausage and Cheese Salad
description: Rinse and trim the bell peppers and remove the seeds and ribs. Cut into strips.

title: Goat Cheese with Basil
description: Rinse the basil, pat dry, and remove the leaves from the stems. Place 1/3 of the cheese mixture into a jar, and top with a layer of basil. Season with salt and pepper, and drizzle with olive oil. Repeat the layers, until all the ingredients have been used. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 day to infuse.

title: Stuffed Eggs
description: Mix basil with lemon juice, oil, and 1/3 of the egg yolk-cream.

title: Stuffed Eggs and Pepper Boats with Cheese Filling
description: Lift out yolks carefully and crush finely with a fork. Finely chop anchovies and then crush with the back of a knife to make a paste. Mix yolks and anchovies with cream fraiche, mustard and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Fill a pastry bag with a star tip with anchovy cream and pipe into egg halves. Garnish with scallion rings.

title: Rose Shape Butter
description: To create flower shape, use a small cone shape in the center and shape circles around it. Place the circle on the bottom and press firmly into place. Start with small circles and finish with big circles. Place butter flowers in ice water until ready to serve.

title: Monkfish with Green Asparagus and Red Wine Dressing
description: Rinse monkfish, pat dry and cut into about 12 bite-sized pieces. Season with salt and pepper. Heat 1-2 tablespoons of oil in a nonstick pan and cook fish for about 2-3 minutes per side or until golden brown.

title: Mixed Grilled Skewers
description: Press the garlic and mix in a bowl with the herbs, pepper, mustard, lemon juice and oil. Add the lamb fillet, pork chops and roulades and marinate in the refrigerator for about 2 hours.

title: Savoury Flan with Carrot and Sprout Salad
description: Preheat oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Grease ramekin or molds with butter.

title: Greek Chicken Patties
description: Peel cucumber. Cut in half lengthwise and scrape out seeds, then cut crosswise into thin slices. Combine cucumber, mint, yogurt and cumin. Season with salt.

title: Beef in Herbs
description: Toast almonds in a dry pan until golden brown. Remove from pan and let cool. Rinse herbs, shake dry, pluck off leaves and chop finely. Mix with almonds and spread mixture on a plate.

title: Green Salad with Nasturtium and Marigold Flowers
description: For the dressing, whisk vinegar with 1-2 tablespoons water and the sugar. Season with salt and whisk in oil. Season to taste and drizzle dressing over salad.

title: Saudi Arabia Style Lamb with Vegetable Filling
description: Rinse bell peppers and chile pepper, halve and remove seeds and ribs, chop. Rinse and chop zucchini. Peel garlic and chop finely. Coarsely chop raisins. Heat oil in a pan and saute garlic and chile pepper briefly. Add bell peppers, zucchini cubes and raisins and saute for 3-4 minutes. Remove from heat and season with lemon juice, salt and pepper.

title: Baked Herb-Stuffed Trout
description: Blanch tomatoes, then peel, quarter, core and roughly chop. Rinse, trim and thinly slice scallions crosswise. Peel and chop garlic. Rinse herbs, shake dry and finely chop.

title: Almond Fish Steaks
description: Rinse the carp, pat dry, cut into chops, and gently score the skin to avoid curling.

title: Rosemary Meatballs with Mint Yogurt Sauce
description: Peel and finely chop the onion. Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large pan and sauté the onion until softened. Remove from heat and let cool. Place the ground meat in a large bowl. Squeeze the excess water from the roll and add to the meat along with the egg, onions, Dijon mustard and chopped herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Mix well with hands and add enough breadcrumbs to thicken the mixture so that it's moldable. Shape into small balls.

title: Clams with Vegetables
description: Rinse, trim and cut the zucchini in half lengthwise.

title: Turkey Strips with Vegetables
description: Rinse and dry cabbage, cut into strips. Rinse bell peppers and halve, remove seeds and ribs, cut into strips. Rinse leek and cut into fine strips.

title: Marinated Anchovies
description: Peel and finely chop the garlic. Rinse the parsley, pat dry, remove the leaves and finely chop.

title: Italian Salad Dressing
description: Rinse the basil, pat dry, and finely chop. Mix into the dressing, season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve.

title: Grilled Pork and Vegetable Skewers
description: Heat the grill to medium and lightly oil the grates. Peel and finely chop the garlic. Mix garlic with oil and sprinkle over skewers. Grill turning the skewers as they cook and brushing them regularly with the garlic and oil. Season with salt and pepper and serve the immediately.

title: Turkey Escalopes with Wild Garlic
description: Spread mixture on cutlets and top with remaining garlic leaves. Fold in half and secure with toothpicks. Heat oil in a pan and cook escalopes for about 5 minutes per side or until crispy brown. Remove from the pan and arrange on plates. Serve.

title: Classic Carpaccio
description: Mix the lemon juice with some salt, and incorporate the oil completely.

title: Spanish-style Meatballs
description: Peel onion and garlic and finely chop. Sauté onion and garlic in a pan with 1 tablespoon hot oil until translucent. Let cool slightly and mix with egg, parsley and meat. Add breadcrumbs until mixture is easy to shape. Season well with salt, pepper, sherry, cumin, cilantro and nutmeg. Shape mixture into small meatballs.

title: Marinated Sun-Dried Tomatoes
description: Peel the garlic, and rinse the rosemary. Remove the tomatoes from the bowl and drain on paper towels. Layer the tomatoes, garlic, and rosemary in a mason jar. Cover with the oil, and seal tightly. Let infuse for at least 3 hours before serving.

title: Watercress and Orange Salad
description: Arrange watercress with orange slices and pine nuts on plates, drizzle with the dressing and serve.
types: ['Tropical Fruit', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo Side Dish', 'Seed', 'Salad with Fruit', 'Menu', 'low-carb']

title: Ham and Herbs Stuffed Eggs
description: For the herb filling: Mix 4 egg yolks with the heavy cream until smooth, stir in the horseradish and herbs. Fill a piping bag with the cream mixture and pipe some of the mixture into the the egg white halves of 4 eggs. Garnish with watercress.

title: Turkey Cutlets with Mushrooms and Roquefort Cream
description: Serve with rice, if desired.

title: Beef Broth with Egg Custard and Vegetable Stars
description: Place the meat in a large pot cover with cold water and bring to a boil. Skim the resulting foam. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 2.5 hours. If necessary add more water to keep the meat and bones covered. After about 1 hour, add the vegetables, peppercorns and parsley and continue to simmer.

title: Endive Gratin
description: In a small saucepan, melt butter and dust with flour.

title: Spinach-Stuffed Omelets
description: For the filling: Rinse spinach and cook in a pot with about 1 liter (approximately 4 cups) of boiling salted water. Drain spinach in a colander, rinse and drain again. Squeeze well and coarsely chop.

title: How to Cut Up Poultry
description: Place the poultry on its back. Pull the legs from the torso and separate them with a sharp knife through the leg joints.

title: Variations of Herbal Oils
description: Rinse the herbs and chile peppers, shake dry and optionally air dry to dry completely (moisture spoils the oil!).

title: Salad with Chicken, Avocado, and Crispy Croutons
description: Rinse the chicken breasts, pat dry, and cut into strips or cubes. Sauté for 2–3 minutes in 1–2 tablespoons hot oil until golden brown. Remove from the heat and leave until done. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Roast Beef with Remoulade and Garlic Mayonnaise
description: For the roast beef, rinse the meat and pat dry. Score the fat layer with a diamond-shaped pattern. Season with salt and pepper and rub with mustard.

title: Peeling and Deveining Shrimp
description: First turn head and remove from the body.

title: Paschal Eggs with Filling
description: For first filling, rinse the radishes, peel and finely chop. Finely chop the dill pickle. Mix the dill pickle and radishes with the quark. Add the chives, and season with salt and pepper.

title: Hearty Chicken Stew
description: Rinse chicken inside and out and cut with poultry shears into 2 breasts and 2 legs.

title: Gorgonzola Cheese Sauce
description: Mix in the wine before serving. Season to taste with pepper, transfer to a bowl, and garnish with the chives.

title: Cheesy Pear Spread
description: Peel the pear and cut into quarters. Remove the core and finely chop. Rinse and trim the scallions and cut into thin rings.

title: Rice Paper Spring Rolls
description: Soak the cellophane noodles in hot water for about 10 minutes, drain and chop with scissors.

title: Deep-fried Coconut Shrimp
description: Drain shrimp on paper towels and serve immediately.

title: Spicy Cinnamon Butter
description: Chill the butter in the refrigerator. Remove from the refrigerator 20 minutes prior to serving. Mix well, and let soften slightly.

title: Creamy Garlic Dip
description: Add to a bowl, and refrigerate until ready to serve.

title: Turkey and Spinach Roulades
description: Rinse turkey, pat dry, flatten and season with salt, pepper and paprika. Mash Gorgonzola with a fork. Spread spinach and Gorgonzola onto turkey and fold up. Secure with roulade pins. Heat butter in a pan and add turkey cutlets. Cook for 5-7 minutes on all sides.

title: Pork Loaf
description: Line a loaf pan with bacon slices.

title: Mediterranean Goat Cheese Pastry
description: Spread filo dough sheets on a flat working surface and stack. With a pastry wheel, cut into 8 rectangles of about 20 x 18 cm (approximately 8 x 7 inches). Remove excess dough.

title: Salad with Mushrooms and Crispy Bacon
description: Whisk vinegar with two types of oil and season with salt, pepper and sugar. Spread lettuce and mushrooms on plates and toss with the dressing.

title: Bell Peppers with Feta Cheese
description: Slice sun-dried tomatoes into strips and heat the oil in a large skillet. Add bell peppers, rosemary and onions and sauté for 6-8 minutes. Season with pepper and vinegar. Add olives. Cut the feta cheese into chunks and mix into the vegetables. Heat again briefly and season with a little salt.

title: Kohlrabi and Pork Chops
description: Heat the butter and flour. Drain the kohlrabi, collecting the cooking water. Add the kohlrabi water to the butter and flour with the milk and cream. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Add kohlrabi. Pluck the basil leaves from the stems and set a few aside. Chop the rest.

title: Asian Style Rutabaga
description: Peel rutabaga and cut into fine strips. Rinse bell pepper, cut into quarters, remove seeds and ribs and cut into fine strips. Rinse broccoli, trim and divide into florets. Blanch broccoli in a pot with plenty of salted water for 2-3 minutes. Drain.

title: Shrimp Scampi with Walnuts
description: Rinse, trim and cut scallions diagonally into pieces. Rinse, trim and halve chiles and thinly slice crosswise. Cut ginger slices into strips.

title: Fried Tofu with Avocado Sauce
description: Rinse and drain sprouts. To make dressing, whisk lemon juice with oil and season with salt and pepper. Mix sprouts with dressing and set aside. Halve avocados, remove pits and scoop out flesh. Coarsely chop avocados and puree with white wine vinegar. Stir in yogurt. Season with salt, pepper and sambal oelek.

title: Ground Lamb Kebabs with Garlic Yogurt
description: Soak toast in a bowl of water. Mix ground lamb in a bowl with egg, bacon-onion mixture and drained toast, knead and season with salt and pepper. Shape ground lamb mixture into small balls using hands. Heat oil in a pan and fry meatballs for a few minutes on all sides. Remove from the pan and drain on absorbent paper towel.

title: Asparagus Salad with Salmon Mousse
description: Cut the salmon into pieces, transfer to a blender and puree along with the shallot cream. Transfer to a bowl, fold in the crème fraîche, season with salt, pepper and lemon juice, cover and refrigerate.
types: ['Vegetable', 'Gluten-free', 'Gluten-free Dinner', 'Gluten-free Fish Recipe', 'Gluten-free Lunch', 'low-carb', 'low-carb fish', 'meat-free', 'Terrine', 'Salmon Terrine', 'Spring', 'Spring Vegetable', 'festively', 'Guest', 'Sunday cooking', 'Cooking', 'Fish', 'saltwater\xa0Fish', 'Sprout', 'Dairy', 'salad', 'Vegetable Salad', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Appetizer']

title: Chicken Fillets in Vegetable Sauce
description: Meanwhile, peel and finely chop the carrots and the celery. Cut the leek in half, rinse thoroughly and finely dice. Remove the chicken. Sauté the vegetables in oil for 2 minutes. Season with garlic, salt, pepper and vinegar and top with broth.
types: ['Cooking', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo dinner', 'Paleo Main Dish', 'Paleo lunch', 'Meat', 'Poultry', 'Chicken', 'Vegetable', 'Herb', 'Course', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Menu', 'Main Course', 'low-carb']

title: Chicken Breast Fillet with Herb Crust and Lime Hollandaise
description: Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil. Bake in a preheated oven at 220°C (approximately 425°F/ gas mark 3-4 / convection 190°C or 375°F) for 15-20 minutes. Remove and keep warm.

title: Braised Cabbage with Tomatoes
description: Toast pine nuts in a dry skillet. Remove from the skillet and set aside.

title: Beef Fillet with Shallots and Creamy White Wine Sauce
description: Add the beef to the roasting pan, cover with a lid and braise for 8-10 minutes. Remove the beef and cover with aluminum foil to rest.

title: Vegetable Stew with Smoked Pork and Chive Pesto
description: Peel carrots, cut into slices and add to the pot after 15 minutes. Peel celery, cut into thin slices and add to pot after 20 minutes. Rinse leeks thoroughly, cut into thin rings and add to pot after 25 minutes. Season stew with salt and pepper.

title: Bacon Cabbage Flatbread with Eggs and Tomato
description: For the topping, cut cabbage in thin strips and blanch for 2-3 minutes in boiling, salted water. Drain cabbage in a colander. Pat dry with paper towels, if needed.

title: Meatballs with Tomato and Caper Sauce
description: Cut feta cheese into cubes. Make balls out of the meat mixture and add cheese cubes to them. Heat oil to 175°C (approximately 350°F) and cook meatballs, few at a time, until golden brown on all sides. Drain meatballs on paper towels.

title: Turnip Salad with Arugula
description: Rinse and trim arugula. Rinse and halve the cherry tomatoes. Rinse, trim and slice the mushrooms.

title: Layered Tri-color Vegetable Mousse on Arugula
description: Whip cream until stiff. When carrot mixture begins to set, fold in 1/3 whipped cream. Spread carrot mousse in an even layer in bowl, spread top until smooth and refrigerate.

title: Purslane Salad with Eggs, Bacon and Bell Peppers
description: Hard boil the eggs in a pot of water. Drain, rinse with cold water and peel. Cook the bacon in a skillet until crispy. Remove and drain on paper towels.

title: Roast Leg of Lamb with Roquefort Crust
description: Heat ghee in a roasting pan and brown meat on all sides. Add soup vegetables, garlic and rosemary to the pan and saute for a few minutes. Deglaze pan with white wine and roast lamb in preheated oven (electric oven 200°C; convection oven 180°C; gas mark 5) (approximately 400°F) for about 60 minutes. Baste meat with cooking juices often.

title: Pea Soup with Smoked Salmon
description: Puree soup and season with salt, pepper, lemon juice and sugar.

title: Roast Ham with Cloves and Honey Mustard Crust
description: Mix the mustard with the honey. Brush onto the roast for the last 20 minutes. Let sit for at least 15 minutes before cutting. Decorated with oranges and serve.

title: Pepper and Fish Soup
description: Peel onions and garlic and dice. Heat olive oil in a pot. Saute onions and garlic for few minutes. Add tomatoes and peeled peppers and simmer for 5 minutes. Add broth and season with salt, pepper and cumin powder. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.

title: Sautéed Sole and Shrimp with Asparagus, Lemongrass and Ginger
description: Heat the peanut oil in a wok or nonstick skillet and saute the ginger, chopped garlic and lemongrass until the garlic is tender. Remove with a slotted spoon. Add the garlic slices to the pan and saute until golden brown, adding the basil during the last few seconds of cooking. Drain on paper towels.
types: ['Appetizer', 'Root Vegetable', 'Onion', 'Spices', 'Herb', 'Shrimp', 'Meal for Four', 'High-protein Fish Dish', '500-600 Calorie', 'low-carb fish', 'low-carb']

title: Crayfish and Bean Salad
description: Peel and finely chop the shallots. Wipe the mushrooms with a damp paper towel and cut into slices. In a bowl, whisk the oil with the vinegar. Drizzle on top of the beans, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle the shallots and mushrooms on top of the beans. Rinse the herbs, shake dry and chop. Sprinkle the herbs over the beans.

title: Fillet of Perch with Tomato Sauce
description: Heat a little butter in a skillet, dip the fish fillets in the cream and briefly saute.
types: ['Appetizer', 'with Alcohol', 'Freshwater Fish', 'fruit-vegetable', 'Onion', 'Spices', 'Herb', 'Dairy', 'Sauce', 'Meal for Four', 'High-protein Fish Dish', '400-500 Calorie', 'low-carb fish', 'low-carb']

title: Steamed Plaice with Ratatouille
description: Heat olive oil in a pan. Saute all vegetables for about 6-8 minutes, stirring. Season with salt and pepper, remove from heat and keep warm.

title: Plaice in White Wine and Saffron Sauce
description: Heat oil and 1 tablespoon of butter in a pan. Cook fish rolls for  about 6-8 minutes on all sides and remove from the pan, keep warm. Heat remaining butter in a pan. add flour and saute briefly, stirring well. Deglaze pan with white wine and cream and bring to a boil. Dissolve saffron in a little water and add to the sauce, season with salt, pepper and sugar and simmer for a few minutes.

title: Green Salad with Yellow Tomato Vinaigrette and Mushrooms
description: In a bowl, whisk the balsamic vinegar with the pear juice, maple syrup, ginger and oil. Stir in the tomatoes.

title: Cabbage Lentil Salad
description: In a large bowl, whisk the vinegar with the mustard, and season with salt, pepper and sugar to taste. Gradually whisk in the oil and sherry. Add the lentils, cabbage and bell peppers to the dressing, and toss until combined. Allow to marinate for 10 minutes.

title: Parsley and Spinach Salad with Stuffed Cherry Tomatoes
description: Rinse the basil, shake dry and pluck the leaves from the stems. Chop half of it finely. Peel and dice the onion.

title: Shrimp and Scrambled Eggs over Herb Salad
description: 20 mins

title: Cod with Cabbage and Mushrooms
description: Rinse the cabbage and thinly slice into strips. Wipe the mushrooms with a damp paper towel and thinly slice.

title: Trout with Vegetables
description: Rinse the bell peppers, cut in half lengthwise, remove the seeds and white ribs, and cut into cubes. Peel the cucumber, halve lengthwise, remove seeds with a teaspoon and cut into 1 cm (approximately 1/4 inch) slices.

title: Chicken with Broccoli and Cauliflower
description: Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the chicken and cook until golden. Remove and keep warm. Add the broccoli and cauliflower to the skillet, and cook briefly.

title: Beef Pan
description: Rinse the bell peppers, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs, and cut into thin strips. Rinse the yellow tomatoes, cut into quarters and cut out the stalk. Puree the yellow tomato quarters with the vegetable broth in a blender.

title: Marinated Chicken Breast with Cream Sauce and Sauerkraut
description: For the sauerkraut: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

title: Pancakes with Smoked Fish and Creamy Sauce
description: Crush trout filet with a fork. Whisk creme fraiche ands season with salt and pepper. Cut salmon into thin strips and fold together with trout into creme fraiche.

title: Bologna Vegetable Salad
description: Cut the cucumbers into strips. In a bowl, whisk the vegetable water with the vinegar and oil, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cut the bologna into thin strips. In a bowl, stir the mushrooms with the carrots, peas, cucumbers, bologna and dressing until thoroughly combined. Marinate for 1 hour.
types: ['German-style meat salad', 'Meat', 'Vegetable', 'Spices', 'Herb', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Side Dish', 'Buffet', 'German', 'Easy', 'Family', 'Cooking on vacation', 'crowdpleaser', 'Garden Party', 'Guest', 'low-carb']

title: Cream of Asparagus Soup
description: Stir in the broth. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg to taste. Rinse the watercress and stir half into the asparagus. Cover and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Puree the potatoes and asparagus with an immersion blender, about 15 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and lemon juice to taste. In a bowl, beat the cream until stiff. Stir into the soup. Finely chop the remaining watercress and stir into the soup.
types: ['soup', 'Low-calorie asparagus', 'Vegetarian Soups', 'Spring', 'Summer soup', 'Buffet', 'German', 'Easy', 'Family', 'Cooking on vacation', 'crowdpleaser', 'Guest', 'Vegetable', 'Spices', 'Potato', 'Herb', 'asparagus soup', 'Cream Soup', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Appetizer', 'low-carb']

title: Turbot Fillet with Potato and Cilantro Sauce
description: Rinse turbot fillets, pat dry and season with a little salt. Grease grill pan with a little oil and heat well. Cook fish for about 2-3 minutes per side. Spread potato sauce on plates and top with fish. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve.

title: Green Salad with Strawberries and Gouda
description: Rinse the peppers and chop into quarters. Rinse the strawberries and cut into pieces. Dice the Gouda. Mix the vinegar with the salt, pepper and oil. Gently mix the prepared ingredients with the dressing and serve immediately.

title: Mozzarella Plum Salad
description: Rinse the yellow tomatoes and remove the stem. Cut into eighths. Rinse the mozzarella with cold water. Pat dry and cut into cubes.

title: Sausages Wrapped in Bacon
description: Rinse the cucumber and cut into slices. Drain the carrots. Rinse the peppers and cut into pieces. Arrange everything together on a large plate. Serve with ketchup, mustard, and mayonnaise.

title: Turkey Cutlets with Potato Crust
description: Rinse turkey cutlets and pat dry. Flatten gently and season with iodized salt. Heat sunflower oil in a nonstick skillet and cook turkey cutlets for about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove from the pan and keep warm.

title: Mushrooms with Herb Stuffing
description: Trim the scallions. Peel garlic and finely chop both. Cook chopped mushrooms, scallions, garlic and bread crumbs in olive oil for about 3 minutes. Cool.

title: Summer Salad with Mozzarella
description: Trim and rinse the lettuce and arugula and shake dry. Rinse the tomatoes and cucumber and cut both into slices. Peel the onions and cut into rings.

title: Creamy Mushroom Pan with Eggs
description: Heat butter in a pan and fry the mushrooms and onion for about 10 minutes. Drizzle with lemon juice. Pour in the cream and boil down to a creamy sauce.

title: White Asparagus with Gravlax
description: Rinse and spin dry the salad greens. Whisk vinegar with salt, pepper and oil. Toss the salad with the dressing.

title: Mushroom Pan with Lamb Fillet
description: Peel the carrots and cut into sticks. Boil the carrot sticks in salted water for 6-8 minutes. Drain and let cool.

title: Herb Soup with Broccoli and Asparagus
description: Remove the vegetables from the broth with a skimmer. Melt the butter in a pot, then add the four. Deglaze with the broth and cream, then bring to a boil while stirring.

title: Peppers Stuffed with Ground Beef
description: Cut off lids from the peppers and remove seeds and ribs. Rinse and pat dry peppers and stuff with ground meat mixture.

title: Orange and Thyme Pork
description: Roast in an oven preheated to 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 1 hour. Baste with broth and orange juice.

title: Tomato and Fennel Salad with Pesto
description: Stir the basil pesto with the white wine vinegar. Mix this with the tomatoes, olives, onion and fennel. Fold the mozzarella and arrange on the lettuce. Serve together, garnished with basil leaves.

title: Chicken Breas Twith Herb and Cheese Filling
description: Peel the garlic and cut into slices. Pluck half of the basil leaves from the stems. Lay the breasts in a bowl and drizzle with the pepper lime juice. Distribute basil and garlic on top. Cover and let stand for about 2 hours.

title: Roast Beef with Zucchini Courgettes
description: Rinse and coarsely grate the zucchini. Rinse the mushrooms, dry with a paper towel and cut into thin slices. Cut the mozzarella into small cubes. Rinse the tarragon and basil, shake dry and chop finely.

title: Creamy Spinach Soup
description: Rinse the spinach and arugula and remove the stems. Chop the spinach and arugula. Add the vegetables to the pot and simmer for about 10 minutes.

title: Roasted Asparagus
description: Rinse the sage, shake dry and pluck the leaves from the stems. Add to the asparagus in the final few seconds of cooking. Season with salt and pepper and serve with the turkey breast.

title: Greek Salad
description: For the salad, peel the onion and cut into fine columns. Chop the cucumber into cubes. Trim and chop the bell peppers. Drain the capers and olives. Cut the cheese into cubes.

title: Mushroom Salad
description: Mix together vinegar, salt, pepper and sugar. Add mushrooms and let cool.

title: Artichoke Salad
description: Peel the bell pepper with a peeler and cut into quarters, remove seeds and ribs and rinse. Finely dice the bell pepper.

title: Zucchini Cream Soup with Chanterelles
description: Puree soup with an immersion blender, bring to a boil and whisk in sour cream. Season with iodized salt and ginger powder to taste and keep warm on low heat.
