title: Pumpkin Soup
description: Whip half of the cream until stiff. Puree the soup. Stir in the remaining cream and bring to a boil. Season with salt, pepper, lemon juice, nutmeg and sugar.

title: Mixed Greens with Chicken and Peas
description: Trim the lettuce and tear in bite-sized pieces. Cut the mushrooms into small pieces. Cut the chicken into slices. Arrange the lettuce, chicken, mushrooms and peas on serving plates and drizzle with the kefir-mint dressing.

title: Redfish over Stir-Fried Vegetables
description: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a wok and stir-fry the redfish for about 3 minutes. Set aside.

title: Roasted Fish with Bean Puree
description: Rinse beans well. Cook in boiling salted water for 6-8 minutes and drain well. Chop 2/3 of beans and puree together with vegetable broth. Season with salt and pepper and mix with olive oil.

title: Fried Scallops with White Wine Sauce
description: Rinse the scallops and pat dry. Heat the remaining butter and sauté the scallops for about 5 minutes, turning occasionally. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Beef Fillet in Puff Pastry with Wild Mushrooms
description: Heat oil in a pan and brown the fillet all over. Remove from pan and let cool. Add the mushrooms to the pan and cook over high heat. Reduce heat. Add shallots and butter and sauté briefly. Remove from pan and season with salt and pepper.

title: Lamb Chops with Thyme
description: In a pan, brown the chops on both sides for 2-3 minutes. Season with salt. Shortly before the end of cooking, drizzle with lemon juice and pour in the red wine. Add the remaining thyme to red wine and let stew briefly and remove it. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Serve the lamb chops with the sauce and thyme.

title: Salad with Tofu
description: Cut tofu into small pieces (1x4 cm, approximately 1/3 x 1 1/2 inch). Add salt and pepper, then coat with sesame seeds. Heat some oil in a nonstick pan. Fry the sesame-coated tofu until brown. Drain on paper towels.

title: Salad with Eggplant and Zucchini
description: Rinse and trim zucchini and eggplant, peel with a potato peeler and slice thinly. Peel onions and cut into rings.

title: Salad with Onion and Mozzarella
description: Rinse lettuce, pluck apart into bite-sized pieces and spin dry. Rinse and finely chop scallions. Cut mozzarella into pieces. Rinse basil, pluck the leaves from the stems and shake dry.

title: Pork Chops with Carrots and Brussels Sprouts
description: Heat the butter in a pan and saute the cooked the carrots and Brussels sprouts for 5 minutes. Sprinkle flour over the the carrots and Brussels sprouts and pour 250 ml (approximately 1¼ cups) cooking water. Bring to a boil, stirring once in between. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

title: Brisket with Vegetables and Horseradish Sauce
description: Remove meat, leeks and carrots from the broth and strain broth through a sieve. Measure about 1/4 liter of broth (approximately 1 cup).

title: Clear Mussel Soup
description: Peel the shallots and garlic, and finely chop. Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan and suate the shallots and garlic. Add the thyme and mussels. Pour in the white wine and fish stock, and bring to a boil. Once the mussels open (about 3-4 minutes), lift out the mussels with a skimmer from the broth. Discard the closed shells.

title: Salmon Parcels
description: Rinse the broccoli and cook about 8 minutes in salted water. After 1 minute, remove some of the small florets with a slotted spoon and rinse with cold water. Set aside. Drain the broccoli and place in food processor. Add the cream and puree. Season with salt, pepper and ginger powder. Keep warm.

title: Spicy Honey Garlic Chicken Wings
description: Rinse chile peppers, wipe dry and cut lengthwise. Remove seeds and finely chop. Peel garlic. Mix vinegar, honey, oil, paprika and chile peppers in a bowl. Squeeze garlic through a press into bowl and stir. Brush sauce over chicken wings and cook for an additional 10-15 minutes. If desired, brush with sauce again. Serve with remaining marinade.

title: Baked Redfish with Red Lentils
description: Rinse lentils well and drain. Pour boiling water over and allow to swell for about 5 minutes.

title: Rutabaga Soup with Smoked Pork
description: Remove smoked pork from the broth and dice the meat into cubes. Add rutabaga, leek and parsley to the broth, cover and cook for 40 minutes.

title: Red Lentil Soup with Lamb Fillet
description: Peel and dice the onions. Heat the remaining oil and saute onions until soft. Add the lentils and sprinkle with curry. Remove the pan from the heat and allow to sweat briefly. Place pan back on the heat, add remaining stock and cook lentils for 6 minutes.

title: Vegetable Semolina Soup with Smoked Bacon
description: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large saucepan. Add carrots and celery and braise. Sprinkle the semolina over and stir. Add the broth and cook for 20 minutes. In the meantime, cut the bacon into thin strips. Peel and thinly slice the garlic. Rinse the parsley, shake dry and chop coarsely. Heat the remaining oil in a pan and fry the bacon and garlic.

title: Shrimp and Lime Soup
description: In a pot, boil chicken broth with lemongrass and chile pepper, reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes over medium heat. Rinse two limes in hot water, pat dry and cut into thin slices. Squeeze juice from remaining lime. Rinse shrimp, pat dry and set aside.

title: Perch with Peppers and Cucumber
description: Rinse dill, shake dry and chop finely. Add dill to vegetable mixture. Rinse and pat dry fish, season with salt and pepper. Heat remaining olive oil in a pan and cook fish, skin side down, for about 3-4 minutes. Turn fish over and cook for 2-3 minutes more. Arrange fish with vegetables on plates and serve.

title: Beef with Radicchio and Kumquat
description: Rinse and chop the radicchio, removing any leaves or stems. Rinse the kumquats under hot water and cut into slices. Heat the remaining oil and fry the kumquats in it. Add the radicchio and pistachios and cook briefly.

title: Spicy Mixed Grill
description: Peel and dice the onion and garlic. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil and sauté onion and garlic. Whisk together the remaining olive oil, sherry, lemon juice, orange juice, ketchup, honey and soy sauce. Season with salt, pepper and chili powder. Simmer for 3 minutes. Preheat the grill.

title: Pistachio and Thyme Mozzarella with Tomato Salad
description: Chop pistachios coarsely. Mix with a little salt and pepper. Rinse and shake dry thyme, pluck off leaves and combine with nuts.
types: ['Cheese', 'Eggs', 'Vegetable', 'Spices', 'Seed', 'Herb', 'Brunch', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Side Dish', 'Rustic', 'Buffet', 'Easy', 'Meal for Four', 'Country Style', 'cooking for one', '500-600 Calorie', 'non-alcoholic', 'meat-free', 'Boneless', 'Vegetarian', 'low-carb']

title: Trout in Salt Crust
description: Top with fish and spread with remaining salt mixture. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (gas mark 3-4; convection oven 180°C) (approximately 400°F) for about 40-45 minutes.

title: Spicy Cucumber and Onion Relish
description: Rinse the cucumber, cut in half , scrape out the seeds and dice. Peel and dice the onions. Peel and mince the garlic. Rinse the cilantro, pat dry and remove the leaves.

title: Pickled Zucchini and Onions
description: Combine the sliced onions, vegetable broth, bay leaves and fennel seeds in a large saucepan and bring to a simmer. Add the zucchini slices and cook for another 3-4 minutes. Stir in the white vinegar and olive oil, season with salt and pepper and transfer to clean, glass jars. Seal the jars tightly and store in a cool, dark place.

title: Sausage Pie with Celery and Mushrooms
description: Layer the puff pastry slices on top of each other and cut slightly larger than the pie dish. Place the dough on top of the dish and press down the edges. Cut a hole into the middle for steam. From the remaining puff pastry, cut any desired decorations and put on top of the pie, using water to make them stick. Whisk the egg yolk and brush the pastry with it. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for 30 minutes.

title: Chilled Tomato Consommé with Feta
description: Cut the bell pepper in half lengthwise, remove the ribs and seeds and slice thinly. Rinse the zucchini, cut in half lengthwise and slice thinly. Heat the remaining olive oil in a pan and sauté the bell pepper and zucchini briefly. Season with salt and pepper, remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Ladle the consommé into bowls, distribute the bell pepper and zucchini on top and sprinkle with feta cheese. Garnish with fresh dill sprigs and serve.

title: Asparagus Salad with Marinated Beef
description: For the dressing, whisk remaining olive oil with salt and pepper to taste, lemon juice and sugar. Mix asparagus with dressing. With a very sharp knife, cut beef into thin slices. Break Parmesan into pieces. Lay beef slices on asparagus and top with Parmesan. Serve dusted with a little curry powder.

title: Stuffed Savoy Cabbage with Porcini Mushrooms
description: Spread out the cabbage leaves and fill with the mushroom mixture, then roll up. Heat the remaining oil and fry the cabbage rolls over moderate heat. Pour in the soaking water from the mushrooms, cover and cook for 30 minutes. Remove the cabbage and keep warm. Add the cream and boil until thickened. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange the cabbage on plates, top with the sauce and serve.

title: Beef Stew with Sweet Potatoes
description: Squeeze the juice from the lemon. Add lemon juice. grated rind and tomato paste to the meat. Rinse the bell peppers and cut into 3 cm (approximately 1 1/2 inch) pieces. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut into 4 cm long 3 cm thick (approximately 2 inch long 1 1/2 inch thick) pieces. Rinse the tomatoes, cut in half, remove seeds and stem and cut into thin wedges. Add the sweet potatoes and bell peppers to the meat. and cook for 5-8 minutes. Mix the cream and flour until smooth and use to thicken the stew. Season with salt and pepper. Add the tomatoe wedges to the stew and heat briefly. Serve the stew with thyme and lemon zest.

title: Asparagus and Prosciutto Pasta Salad

After 1 hour, turn the ham and add 150 ml (approximately 2/3 cup) more water.

description: Trim vegetables, rinse and chop to desired size. Blanch vegetables separately in boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water. Peel and halve garlic. description: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan and sauté the onion and garlic until golden brown. Add the chile and tomatoes and cook briefly. Deglaze with vermouth and fish stock. Simmer, covered, for 15 minutes.

title: Roasted Salmon with Lemon and Basil Sauce
description: Mix egg yolks in a bowl with lemon juice and lemon zest in a metal bowl. Beat egg yolk mixture with a whisk over a hot water bath. While stirring continuously, add butter and creme fraiche and season with salt, pepper and sugar.

title: Beef and Pea Soup
description: Rinse, peel and dice the soup vegetables. Peel and dice the onion.

title: Pike with Creamy Caper Sauce
description: For the sauce: Remove the fish from the cooking water. Bring back to a boil and cook down to 250 ml (approximately 1 cup) over high heat then strain. Melt the butter, add the flour and stir until light golden brown and nutty. Gradually pour in the boiling water, stirring. Bring back to a boil, stir in the sour cream and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Rinse the anchovy fillets and chop very finely. Mix into the sauce along with the capers. Season with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Stir in the nutmeg and sugar.

title: German-style Snail Soup
description: Whisk the cream and egg yolks together then stir into the soup. Add the snails and simmer for 3-4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve garnished with parsley.

title: Crayfish Soup
description: Rinse the soup vegetables, trim and chop. Peel the onion and cut into quarters. Arrange the vegetables in a roasting pan along with the crayfish shells. Drizzle with oil and roast in a preheated oven at 250°C (approximately 475°F) for 15 minutes. Add the stock and roast for another 15-25 minutes. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve.

title: Spanish Tortilla with Black Olives and Mozzarella
description: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet and sweat the onions until soft. Peel the garlic, mince and add to the pan along with the potatoes and olives. Sauté briefly. Season with salt and pepper. Whisk the eggs. Tear the mozzarella into small pieces, sprinkle over the potatoes and then pour the eggs over the potato mixture.

title: Wild Boar Roast with Elderberry Apples and Kale Gratin
description: For the kale gratin: Remove the stems from the kale and chop coarsely. Blanch in boiling salted water until wilted then drain. Peel the onions and chop finely. Heat the butter in a large saucepan and sauté the onions until golden brown. Squeeze out the excess water from the kale, add to the onions and season with salt and pepper. Add the cream with vegetable broth and simmer for about 20 minutes, until almost all liquid evaporates. Chop the walnuts. Transfer the kale to a buttered baking dish and sprinkle with the walnuts. Top with pats of butter and bake for 30 minutes, until golden brown.

title: Crudite with Aioli
description: For the aioli, peel garlic and cut into small pieces. Puree garlic in a blender with egg yolks and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Slowly add olive oil drop by drop while stirring.

title: Papaya and Mango Salad with Cream Cheese Balls
description: Cut the papaya in half and remove the seeds. Peel the fruit and cut into pieces. Peel the mango and cut the flesh into columns. Rinse the sprouts briefly and drain. Brush the endive, rinse and shake dry.

title: Vegetable Gratin
description: Slice the lamb into thick slices. Peel and chop the onion and garlic. Heat the olive oil. Saute the lamb on both sides. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from the pan.

title: Pork Marsala with Green Asparagus
description: Peel shallots and cut into wedges. Dice tomatoes into small pieces. Heat olive oil in a pan. Add shallots and tomatoes and sauté briefly. Deglaze with Marsala and beef stock and bring to a boil. Season with salt and pepper. Add pork slices and simmer for 5 minutes.

title: Your connection was interrupted
description: For the crepes, stir flour, butter, eggs, salt, water and milk until smooth and let stand about 10 minutes.

title: Radicchio with Avocado and Scallops
description: Whisk remaining lime juice and zest mix with walnut oil. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange prepared ingredients on plates and drizzle with vinaigrette.

description: Line a shallow rectangular baking dish (about 22 x 28 cm or 8 1/2 x 11 inches) with parchment paper. Pour in batter and smooth top. description: Place pumpkin slices on an appropriately-sized piece of parchment paper. Brush slices with half of the poppy butter. Fold parchment paper and seal by twisting the ends together firmly. Set parchment on directly on the wire shelf of a preheated oven. Bake at 200°C (gas mark 3-4, fan: 180°C) (approximately 400°F), 25-30 minutes.

title: Poached Carp with Tarragon and Onions
description: Rinse the tarragon, pat dry, remove the leaves and chop finely. Add the chopped tarragon to the pan. Rinse the carp, pat dry and add to the pan. Cook over low heat for about 10 minutes, until opaque.

title: Egg Soup for Easter
description: Peel the carrots and cut into slices. Remove the bay leaf and puree the soup fine, add the carrots to it and simmer for about 10 minutes.

title: Rilette of Smoked Mackerel
description: Spread on bread slices and serve.

title: Flounder with Vegetables
description: Drain the tomatoes (collecting the oil) and cut into strips.

title: Asparagus with Egg and Scallion Dressing
description: Peel the asparagus and place on the sheet. Cover with the remaining butter, season with salt and sugar and cover with aluminum foil. Bake for about 30 minutes.

title: Salmon and Asparagus with Honey-Lemon Sauce
description: Rinse the salmon, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large, non-stick pan and cook the salmon with the lemon wedges for about 6-8 minutes, turning once, until golden brown.

title: Seafood Frittata
description: Rinse the seafood and drain well. Heat the oil in an ovenproof skillet. Peel and finely chop the onion and garlic and saute until translucent. Add the seafood and sauté briefly. In a bowl, beat the eggs with the cream and the turmeric and season with salt and pepper. Rinse the arugula, spin dry, pluck the leaves and stir into  the eggs along with the marjoram. Pour over the seafood, place in the oven and bake until the eggs are set, about 20 minutes.

title: Entrecote with Olive and Anchovy Butter
description: Rinse the steaks, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat the butter in a skillet and sear the steaks on both sides, transfer to a baking pan.

title: Chinese Pork
description: Heat oil in a wok. Sear meat. Add garlic, onion, asparagus, scallions, peppers, curry paste and ginger, saute for 2-3 minutes, Add broth. Add sugar, a little soy and oyster sauces and simmer for 6-8 minutes. Vegetables should be soft and liquid almost evaporated. Season with chile sauce, oyster sauce and soy sauce.

title: Asparagus Pesto
description: Rinse the basil, shake dry, pluck off the leaves and place in a blender with the asparagus.

title: Open-Faced Crab and Scrambled Egg Sandwiches
description: Spread the remaining butter over the bread. Place the scrambled eggs on the bread, season with salt and pepper. Top with the crayfish and serve sprinkled with chives.

title: Pork Chops with Carrot Puree
description: Rinse pork chops, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a grill pan and cook chops for about 2-3 minutes per side or until golden brown on high heat. Reduce heat and cook for 5 minutes more.

title: Cod with Mushrooms and Soy Sauce
description: Wipe and trim the mushrooms and cut into slices. Rinse and trim the leeks and cut into rings.

title: Salad with Crispy Chicken
description: Rinse the chicken, pat dry and cut into strips. Cook in hot oil in a nonstick pan until golden brown 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat, deglaze pan with the soy sauce and the honey, season with salt and pepper.

title: King Prawn Balls with Herbs
description: Mix the cream, salt and cayenne pepper and make a puree in a blender. Rub the king prawns with lemon juice and shape each into small balls (best with damp hands).

title: Lamb Skewers with Honey-Scallion Sauce
description: Rinse the lamb, pat dry and cut into large cubes. Thread on wooden skewers. In a mortar, coarsely grind the fennel and coriander seeds, transfer to a bowl and stir in the oil, season with salt and pepper. Brush the meat with the oil and grill, turning the meat as it cooks for  8-10 minutes.

title: Basil Vinaigrette
description: Rinse the basil, shake dry and pluck off the leaves. Place in a bowl with the balsamic vinegar.

title: Eggs Baked with Parmesan
description: Preheat the oven broiler.

title: Honey Mustard Drumsticks
description: Rinse drumsticks and pat dry. Mix mustard in a bowl with honey, oil and lemon juice. Add drumsticks, mix well and season with salt. Place coated drumsticks on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cook in the oven for about 25 minutes until golden brown. From time to time during the cooking time turn drumsticks over. Serve immediately on a plate garnished with chopped scallions if desired.

title: Stir-fried Prawns with Snow Peas and Asparagus
description: Peel garlic and chop finely. Rinse prawns, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large pan and fry prawns with garlic and ginger for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Add drained vegetables to the pan, fry together while stirring for 1-2 minutes and season with salt and pepper.

title: Meatloaf with Vegetables
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F) top and bottom heat. Grease a baking dish with olive oil.

title: This site can’t be reached
description: Rinse lamb, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat 1-2 tablespoons oil in a pan and fry lamb on all sides until brown, remove from the pan and directly on the oven rack (with drip pan under) and cook for about 1.5 hours.

title: Roast Pork with Cauliflower
description: For the pork, rinse meat, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Rub on cumin and place fat side down in a greased roasting pan. Pour in 200 ml (approximately 1 cup) water and roast for 20 minutes. Turn meat over, cut diamond patterns into rind and pour in beer and broth. Braise at 160°C (approximately 325°F) for 1 1/2 hours.

title: Roasted Duck, with Orange, Honey and Cress
description: Rinse duck breasts, pat dry, cut the skin in a diamond-shaped pattern and season with salt and pepper. Heat a pan and fry duck breast with the skin-side down for about 5 minutes until done. Then turn over, fry briefly and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven and let cook until done 35-40 minutes.

title: Lentil Salad with Steak Patties
description: Peel and slice carrots. Rinse and dry scallions, cut into rings. Add to the lentils during the last 5 minutes of cooking.

title: Chicken Fricasee
description: Rinse the chicken, pat dry and cut into 8 pieces.

title: Herb Infused Vinegar
description: Strain the vinegar into a clean bottle, and seal tightly.

title: Chicken with Garlic
description: Separate the garlic bulb into cloves, peel, and place in an even bed in an oiled roasting pan. Rinse the chicken, pat dry, and cut into quarters or eighths. Brush the chicken with the remaining oil and season with salt and pepper. Place the chicken, skin side up, on the garlic. Roast for about 15 minutes in the oven, and then pour the wine over the chicken. Continue to roast another 20 minutes, adding water as needed to keep the garlic moist. Baste the chicken occasionally with the pan juices.

title: Zucchini Pancakes with Tuna Salad
description: For the pancakes: peel and finely chop onion and garlic. Heat oil in a pan and saute both until translucent. Remove from heat and let cool. Rinse and trim zucchini, grate and place in a colander, season with salt and let stand for about 20 minutes. Squeeze well and combine with onion mixture. Whisk eggs with herbs. Gradually add flour to zucchini mixture and mix well. Add beaten eggs and enough breadcrumbs to make malleable mixture, season with pepper.

title: Omelet with Vegetables
description: Cut the potatoes into slices. Rinse, trim and slice the zucchini. Place in salted boiling water for about 10 minutes. Then pat dry. Rinse and halve the tomatoes. Rinse, trim and cut scallions into thin rings.

title: Beef Rolls Stuffed with Egg, Carrots and Bell Pepper
description: Rinse the bell peppers, cut into quarters, peel with a peeler, trim and cut into strips.

title: Monkfish with Herbs Purée
description: Peel onion and chop finely. Heat butter in a pan and saute until translucent. Add flour and mix well. Add herbs and cream, simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat, whisk in egg yolks and Parmesan, season with salt and nutmeg.

title: Roast Lamb with Garlic and Herb Crust
description: Rinse the meat, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Sear in hot oil on all sides.Place on a roasting rack over a drip pan, and cook in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes.

title: Cabbage Salad with Chicken and Mushrooms
description: Scrub the cabbage, cut out the core and chop. In the rest, hot fry oil. Add salt, pepper and deglaze with a little water. Cover and cook about 10 minutes until soft. Then remove the lid and allow to cool until lukewarm.

title: Herb and Egg Parcels
description: For the filling, rinse the herbs, shake dry, pluck the leaves and finely chop. Peel the shallot and garlic, and finely chop. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pan and saute the onion and garlic in it until translucent. Mix in the herbs and let cool. Season with salt and nutmeg.

title: Scallions with Cheese Sauce
description: Brush the scallion sticks with oil, season with salt and pepper and cook on the grill for 5-6 minutes, while turning.

title: Beef Goulash with Onion
description: Heat oil in a saucepan. Add meat and sear while stirring occasionally. Add onions and cumin to the pan and cook for a few minutes. Add garlic and mix in tomato paste. Deglaze with red wine. Add about 300 ml (approximately 1-1/4 cup) of broth. Mix in paprika and cover, gently simmering for about 1.5 hours on low heat. Stir occasionally and add more broth as needed.

title: Salmon Salad
description: Combine the cream cheese with the lemon zest and mix until creamy. Season with salt and pepper and distribute spoonfuls over the salad.

title: Irish Beef Stew with Beer
description: Peel carrot and cut into pieces. Rinse leeks, trim and cut into thick rings. Peel garlic clove and shallot.

title: A Trio of Fish Tartares with Parsley Sauce
description: For the fish tartares: Rinse the fish fillets, pat dry and cut each into very small cubes. Peel and finely chop the shallot. Divide the shallots, herbs and grapeseed oil among the 3 types of fish. Season each with lemon juice, salt and pepper.

title: Egg and Leek Gratin
description: Rinse the leek, cut in half lengthwise and then cut into fine strips. Peel and finely chop the garlic.

title: Radish Salad with Trout
description: Toast bread slices.

title: Carp with Creamy Sauce and Potato Cubes
description: For the potato cubes: peel potatoes and cut into small cubes. Blanch  in boiling salted water for about 1-2 minutes. Drain and pat dry. Heat oil in a pan and saute for about 2-3 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Season with salt and drain on paper towels.

title: Eggs in Horseradish Sauce with Beets

title: Meatballs with Tomato Sauce
description: Heat oil in a pan and cook meatballs, few at a time, until golden brown on all sides. Drain on paper towels.

title: Simple Egg Custard
description: Whisk the heavy cream and eggs together until smooth. Season with nutmeg and salt.

title: Marrow Dumplings
description: Loosen marrow from bones. Rinse parsley, shake dry and mince leaves.

title: Pan Fried Trout with Herb Butter
description: Rinse the trout and pat dry. Season with salt and pepper inside and out and lightly dust the skin with flour. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan and cook the trout for about 5 minutes on each side. Transfer to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and finish cooking in the oven for about 15 minutes.

title: Coconut and Chicken Soup
description: Heat coconut oil in a saucepan and saute the ginger with garlic, chile pepper and lemongrass. Pour the vegetable broth and coconut milk, add the chicken breasts, and season with salt and pepper. Simmer over medium heat for about 15 minutes.

title: Beef Stew
description: In a saucepan heat oil and brown meat in portions. Season with paprika, remove from heat and set aside.

title: Infused Olive Oil
description: For the chile oil,  carefully handling hot peppers, pierce with a fork several times and place in bottle. Pour in peppercorns.

title: Sun-Dried Tomato Butter
description: Beat the butter with an electrix mixer until fluffy. Mix in the diced tomatoes, basil, and tomato paste. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and crushed chili flakes. Form into a roll and wrap in aluminum foil. Chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours before using.

title: Anchovy-Lemon Butter
description: Rinse the herbs, pat dry, and finely chop the leaves.

title: Pork Goulash with Sauerkraut
description: Heat the oil in a pot. Add the pork and cook until browned. Add the onions and garlic, and continue to cook until golden brown. Stir in the tomato paste and cook briefly. Add enough broth so the meat is just covered. Season with the paprika, cumin, juniper berries and bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover halfway and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 hour. Add more broth as required.

Place the slices on a parchment lined baking sheet and bake in the preheated oven for about 12 minutes until golden. Remove, cool and serve.

title: Mushrooms Stuffed with Tomato and Mozzarella

title: Fruit and Vegetables Salad

title: Hard-Boiled Eggs with Walnut, Chive and Dill Sauce
description: Whisk yogurt with mayonnaise and sour cream until smooth. Peel cucumber, halve lengthwise, remove seeds and finely dice. Stir cucumbers with yogurt sauce. Stir a third of the dill, chives, and walnuts into the yogurt sauce. Season with lemon juice, salt, sugar, and pepper. Divide some of the sauce among plates, top with eggs, and garnished as desired with additional sauce, walnuts, dill, and chives.

title: Asparagus Soup with Bacon
description: In a pot, cook onion in 1 tablespoon melted butter until translucent. Add potatoes and asparagus and deglaze with white wine. Add beef broth and asparagus cooking liquid. Cover and simmer until vegetables are soft, about 20 minutes. Stir in basil and crème fraîche and puree until smooth. Strain soup through a sieve into a pot. description: Melt butter in a pan over medium-low heat until foamy. Add sage, stir and reduce heat to low (or let brown slightly, if desired). Season with salt and pepper.

title: Poached Eggs with Spinach
description: Bring the vinegar and 1 liter (approximately 1 quart) of water to a simmer in a small pot. Slide each egg into the water carefully. Swirl the the water around each egg to ensure that the egg white fully coats the yolk uniformly.

title: Italian Style Omelette
description: The eggs and milk together until smooth. Stir in the grated parmesan and oregano. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg and pour half of the mixture into the pan. Cook over low heat until the eggs are set around the edges. Carefully flip and continue cooking for 1-2 minutes. Remove from the pan and repeat with the remaining ingredients. Cut into wedges and serve.

title: Classic Omelet
description: Cook until omelet is wet and shiny on top and lightly browned at the edges. Prepare the rest of eggs in the same manner.

title: Salmon in Parchment Paper
description: Rinse salmon, pat dry, and cut into 4 equal pieces. Drizzle with marinade. Let marinate 3 hours.

title: Grilled Pork and Vegetable Kebabs

description: Mix the honey and the mustard, then season with some salt and pepper.

description: Roll the edges of the omelette to the center of the pan, slide onto a plate, season with additional salt and pepper, if desired, and serve.

description: Heat 3-4 tablespoons oil in a pan, add the garlic, ginger, lemon zest and hot pepper. cook briefly and remove from the heat. Add 2-3 tablespoons lemon juice and let rest.

title: Pan-Roasted Salmon Steaks
description: Heat oil in a frying pan. Add salmon steaks and cook until golden-brown, about 2 minutes. Turn steaks with a spatula and fry until other sides are lightly browned, about 2 minutes more. Reduce heat slightly and add butter. Flatten garlic with the palm of your hand and add to pan along with herbs. Continue cooking salmon until cooked through, about 1 minute per side, while basting with butter.

title: Making Mixed Salad
description: Transfer all prepared salad greens to a large bowl of cold water. Swish gently, and remove from water. Spin dry in a salad spinner. Tear any large lettuce leaves into smaller pieces.

title: Poached Eggs
description: Poach the egg for 4 minutes, until the egg white is firm but the yolk is still soft. Carefully lift the egg from the water with a skimmer and rinse briefly.

title: Tomato and Mozzarella Salad
description: Arrange the tomato slices and sliced mozzarella in a fan shape on plates. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil, and garnish with the basil.

title: Scrambled Eggs
description: Melt the butter in a pan, then add the egg mixture. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly. Don't allow the eggs to brown. Cook until the eggs are juicy, and have a sheen to them.

title: Breaded Haddock
description: Pour the oil into a hot frying pan and fry the fish 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown.

title: Poached Fillet of Beef with Vegetables

Remove the vegetables and parsley with a slotted spoon and add the beef fillet to the broth. Keep the broth at about 80°C (approximately 175°F) and poach the beef for about 10 minutes. Add the sliced vegetables to the broth and continue cooking for 10 minutes.

title: Meatballs
description: Mix the ground meat with the eggs, the soaked toast, onions, mustard and paprika in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper and knead into an even mixture.

title: Homemade Pesto
description: Peel and halve the garlic cloves. Finely grate the parmesan cheese.

description: Rinse the tomatoes. Peel and dice the garlic. Rinse the rosemary and thyme, shake dry and pluck the leaves from the stems.

title: Chicken Meatballs with Tomato Sauce
description: Peel onion and garlic and chop finely. Heat oil in a pan and saute onion and garlic until translucent. Add tomato paste and saute briefly, add wine and simmer briefly. Add tomatoes and simmer for about 15 minutes or until sauce thickens.

title: Turkey Rolls with Onion-bacon Sauce
description: Remove the kitchen twine and serve the turkey with the sauce.

title: Baked Cod with Vegetables En Papillote
description: Rinse fish and pat dry, season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with lemon juice.

title: Grilled Mackerel with Tomato Salad
description: For the salad: rinse tomatoes, cut into quarters, remove seeds and dice. Rinse basil, shake dry, set some leaves aside and cut the rest into strips. Peel shallot and garlic and grate on a vegetable slicer in a bowl. Add tomatoes and chopped basil, mix well. Whisk balsamic vinegar with oil, season with salt and pepper. Toss salad with the dressing. Arrange grilled mackerel on plates and place salad into small bowls. Garnish with basil leaves and serve with fish.

title: Tuna Appetizers
description: Toast the bread until crispy. Then cut using a ring disc to about 6 cm (approximately 2 1/4 inch) in diameter. Fill the tuna mixture on the bread with the ring, press it down slightly, then remove the ring again. Depending on preference, add a dab of sour cream and caviar on top and garnish with parsley. Serve.

title: Spicy Pork Ribs
description: Rinse ribs and divide into individual pieces. Place ribs into a casserole and coat thickly with sauce. Bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 40 minutes. While baking, baste with sauce often. If needed, add some water to the pan.

title: Salmon Appetizers
description: Grease wells of a muffin pan with the butter. Roll out the puff pastry, then roll slightly larger on a floured surface. Cut out rounds with a pastry wheel 10-12 cm (approximately 4-5 inches) in diameter and put into the muffin cups. Trim parchment paper to size and line the cups. Top with legumes or pie weights. Bake in the oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Remove and let cool.

title: Cream Cheese Balls
description: Mix the parsley with the chives and place on a plate. Coarsely crush the peppercorns place on a separate plate. Place the walnuts and place on a third plate. Sprinkle the paprika and curry powder seperately into lines on a fourth plate.

title: Fish Soup with Vegetables
description: Trim and rinse the fennel. Cut in half, remove the stalk and cut the tuber into strips. Trim, rinse and thinly slice the celery. Peel the carrot and cut into fine sticks. Trim and rinse the leeks and cut into rings.

title: Fried Walleye with Asparagus and Peppers
description: Peel and dice the onion and garlic. Sauté in 1 tablespoon of hot oil. Add the tomatoes and about 200 ml (approximately 3/4 cup) of the broth and simmer for about 10 minutes. Puree and add broth as needed. Simmer several minutes until creamy.

title: Meatballs
description: Rinse parsley, shake dry and chop finely. Peel onion and garlic, dice finely. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan and saute onion and garlic with bay leaf until translucent. Remove bay leaf and mix onion and garlic with well-squeezed bread, ground meat, egg yolk, parsley, allspice, ginger powder, salt and pepper. Knead into malleable mixture.

description: Remove from the oven and let rest briefly. Season with salt and slice. Serve.

description: For the fish: rinse fish fillets, pat dry and sprinkle with lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper and coat with flour lightly. Heat oil in a pan and cook fish fillets for about 2 minutes per side or until golden brown. Arrange on plates and sprinkle with chili flakes and garnish with baby spinach and lemon slices. Serve with pesto.

description: Heat a large saucepan and fry the ostrich fillets along with the marinade in it until brown on all sides for about 10 minutes. Drizzle with the honey and season with salt. Serve the ostrich fillets in a bowl and garnish with herbs. Serve as per choice with flatbread.

description: Peel the onions and dice. Cut the bacon into strips. Fry the onions and bacon in the same roasting pan. Rinse and peel the tomatoes. Peel and halve the garlic. Add the tomatoes and garlic to the bacon in the roasting pan and pour the white wine. Add the fried rolled lamb and place the roasting pon in a preheated oven. description: Preheat the oven to 100°C (approximately 200°F).

description: The next day, peel and dice onion. Process onion and marinated boar through a meat grinder. Beat eggs and knead into meat mixture. Mince pork belly and knead into mixture.

title: Roasted Sea Bass on Vegetables
description: Toast pine nuts in a dry skillet until golden brown and then remove. Peel carrot and celery and finely grate. Rinse tomatoes and cut into quarters. Rinse arugula, spin dry and tear into small pieces. Mix pine nuts, carrots, celery, tomatoes and arugula in a large bowl and season with a little salt, pepper and 1-2 tablespoons of lemon juice.

title: Roast Pork
description: Rinse pork, pat dry and rub with salt and pepper.

title: Chicken Crabmeat Casserole
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Brush 4 casserole dishes or ramekins with butter.

title: Halibut with Fruit
description: Rinse fish and pat dry. Divide into 4 equal portions, season with salt and drizzle with 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. Line steamer with parchment paper and spread fish in it. Bring about 1 cm of water to a boil and steam fish, covered, for about 5 minutes on high heat. Rinse chile peppers, halve and remove seeds and ribs, cut into thin rings. Peel kiwis and cut into slices. Season yogurt with salt, pepper, vanilla seeds and lemon juice.

title: Chicken with Morel
description: Peel onion and garlic and finely chop.

title: Carpaccio with Goat Cheese
description: Brush the plates with the lemon oil. Mix the lemon juice with the olive oil. Arrange the beef slices on a plate and brush with the olive oil mixture. Dice the cheese and sprinkle over the top. Drizzle the carpaccio with the remaining lemon oil, and season to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Crayfish Bisque
description: Chop onion, carrots and celery. In remaining oil, cook vegetables until translucent. Add rice, wine and strained crayfish stock. Simmer about 20 minutes. Stir in cream and cognac and puree until creamy. Season with lemon juice, salt and pepper.

title: Coconut Fish Soup
description: In the mean time, rinse the fish, pat it dry and cut into small cubes.

title: Grilled Steak with Tomato
description: Rinse the steaks, pat dry and season with salt and pepper. Brush the hot grill with the oil, place steak on it and grill for 3-8 minutes on each side (depending on thickness and desired doneness of meat). Rinse the tomatoes, remove the stalks and cut into slices. Season with salt and pepper, and grill along with the steak during the last 4-5 minutes of cooking.

title: Cauliflower Gratin
description: Grease a casserole dish with the butter. Rinse the cauliflower and divide into florets. Blanch for 2 minutes in boiling salted water. Remove, drain well, and transfer to the casserole dish. Mix the cream with the milk, cheese, and eggs. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Pour the cream mixture over the cauliflower and bake for 30 minutes, or until golden brown.

title: Beef Stroganoff
description: Heat oil in a pan, brown beef on all sides and then remove from the pan. Add shallots and mushrooms to the pan and saute briefly for 1-2 minutes. Add bell peppers and paprika. mix and then pour in brandy. Add some beef stock and simmer for 2-3 minutes. As required add more beef stock. Add mustard and sour cream, mix well and then add beef and olives to the pan. Simmer over low heat for 3-4 minutes and season with salt and pepper.

title: Turkey Curry with Vegetables
description: Remove from the heat, stir in sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately garnished with dill.

title: Hard-boiled Egg Gratin
description: Preheat broiler. Butter a quiche dish.

title: Stuffed Peppers
description: Rinse, halve and trim the bell peppers. Season with salt and pepper and place in the dish.

title: Fish with Tomatoes and Mozzarella
description: Rinse the cod, pat dry and place on an oiled baking sheet.

title: Saltimbocca with Bacon
description: Heat oil in a pan and cook cutlets for about 5-6 minutes or until golden brown on both sides. Transfer to plates and serve.

title: Deviled Eggs with Cheesy Filling
description: Serve sprinkled with paprika.

title: Cauliflower Salad with Shrimp
description: Allow to cool and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons oil, vinegar, salt, pepper and sugar. Let soak approximately 20 minutes.

title: Grilled Steaks with Peppers
description: Heat grill.

title: Salmon with Cabbage
description: In a second pan, cook coriander seeds until toasted. Add remaining oil and fry peppers and cabbage, about 2 minutes. Add coconut milk and season to taste with remaining lime juice, salt, and pepper. Arrange vegetables on four plates, top with salmon and sprinkle with capers.

title: Turkey Strips with Vegetables and Yogurt Dip
description: Peel the onions and cut into strips. Rinse the zucchinis, cut into quarters and then into strips. Rinse and halve the bell peppers, remove the seeds and ribs and also cut into strips.

title: Salmon with Spinach
description: Rinse the chile pepper and cut into rings. Shower over the salmon, cover and leave to marinate for about 15 minutes.

title: Goulash Soup
description: Meanwhile, rinse the peppers, halve lengthwise and remove the seeds and white ribs. Rinse the zucchini. Cut both the peppers and the zucchini into 1 cm (approximately 1/4-inch) cubes and add to the soup once it's cooked 2 hours. Stir in the marjoram and season with salt, pepper and chile powder. Simmer until the meat and vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Then remove the bay leaf, season to taste and ladle the soup into bowls. Serve sprinkled with freshly chopped parsley.

title: Baked Sea Bass Fillets
description: Mix the hazelnuts, breadcrumbs and the Parmesan in a shallow dish. Place the sea bass fillets with the skin side up and press into breadcrumbs mixture well. Place the coated sea bass fillets in a baking dish greased with oil and bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3) (approximately 400°F) for 10-15 minutes.

title: Baked Lamb with Vegetables
description: Rinse lamb and pat dry. Cut lamb into 1 cm thick (approximately 1/2-inch thick) strips and place in an oil-coated baking dish.

title: Scallop Tartar with Pesto
description: Rinse scallops, pat dry and cut into small pieces. Peel and finely chop shallot. Mix scallops and shallot with the crème fraîche and cream. Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice and divide mixture among small glasses. Top with pesto and refrigerate until chilled before serving.

title: Hearty Meatballs
description: Simmer meatballs in tomatoes with remaining onion mixture and drained beans for about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Curried Turkey and Herb Burgers with Harissa
description: Mix the vegetable mixture with the raisins, herbs, egg, curry, harissa and ground turkey. Add the breadcrumbs, as needed, and season with salt and pepper. Shape into 8 patties and cook in the remaining oil until golden brown on both sides, about 6 minutes.

title: Salmon with Vegetables
description: Rinse salmon, pat dry, season with salt and cook until golden brown in remaining oil in a hot, nonstick pan, about 6 minutes on both sides. Place on top of tomato and cucumber salad and top with chopped watercress. Serve.

title: Beef Steak with Herb Butter
description: Peel garlic, chop and grind finely and mix with a pinch of salt. Rinse herbs, shake dry and set some aside for garnish. Pluck remaining parsley and finely chop. Mix chopped chives along with parsley and butter. Fold in quark and garlic and season with salt, pepper and lemon juice.

title: Pork and Camembert Tartines
description: Spread the cream cheese over the toast and top with the cucumber. Season with salt and pepper then arrange the pork and vegetables over top. Crumble the Camembert over the tartines. Serve garnished with chives, if desired.

title: Turkey Vegetable Skewers
description: Crush coriander in a mortar and mix with lemon juice, curry and oil and season with pepper. Sprinkle curry mixture on skewers and season with salt. Cook under a preheated oven broiler, watching carefully, for about 10 minutes. Turn as needed.

title: Bacon-wrapped Smoked Salmon Mousse
description: Cook the bacon until golden brown in a hot roasting pan. Remove from pan and drain well on paper towels. Once cooled and drained, place 2 pieces of bacon onto parchment paper, overlapping each other. Spoon a bit of the salmon mousse into the center and roll up. Repeat with remaining bacon and salmon mousse.

title: Steak with Potato Topping
description: Preheat oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Chicken and Vegetable Stir Fry
description: Season with soy sauce, rice wine, sugar and pepper. Arrange stir fry on plates, sprinkle with scallions and serve if desired with rice.

title: Red and Yellow Pepper Soup
description: Pour the soup into bowls and serve drizzled with the remaining oil.

title: Stuffed Omelet Parcels
description: Combine the mushrooms, bamboo shoots, scallion and ham with the ground meat and 1 tablespoon cornstarch. Add a pinch of salt, the soy sauce and rice wine. Shape into 8 portions.

title: Monkfish with Tomato Salsa
description: Blanch the tomatoes, peel, quarter and remove the seeds. Cut 2 tomatoes into wedges and thinly slice. Cut the remaining into small cubes. Sweat the onion in 1 tablespoon oil until translucent. Add the diced tomatoes, sugar and cloves and season with salt and pepper. Heat the remaining oil and sear the fish on both sides, around 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand until cooked to your liking. Rinse the basil and set 2 sprigs aside. Finely chop the remaining basil and mix with the tomato sauce. Arrange the tomato slices on serving plates, top with the fish medallions and serve with the tomato sauce and reserved fresh basil leaves.

title: Stuffed Eggs
description: Fill the egg whites with the mixtre and garnish with a pea. Trim the lettuce, remove the core and separate the leaves. Rinse, spin dry and tear into small pieces. Blanch the tomatoes, rinse under cold water, peel, quarter, core and cut the flesh into small pieces. Rinse the cucumber, cut into quarters lengthwise and thinly slice.

title: Grilled Salmon with Vegetables
description: Place the salmon with vegetables on a hot grill or in a hot grill pan and cook for 6-8 minutes, turning often. Serve in dishes garnished with dill and lemon wedges.

title: Canapes with Smoked Fish
description: Place cream cheese mixture into a piping bag with a large tip. Pipe cream cheese onto prepared bread, divide smoked trout into pieces and place trout over cream cheese. Serve with sprinkled freshly grated horseradish.

title: Roast Beef
description: Roast in preheated oven at 160°C (approximately 325°F) for about 45-55 minutes. Remove from the oven and slice thinly. Arrange on plates and serve with cranberry butter, if desired.

title: Mediterranean Fish Soup
description: Rinse and shake dry scallions. Cut diagonally into rings. Rinse and dry celery and fennel, cut into small pieces. Blanch tomatoes with hot water, peel, quarter and dice. Clean mushrooms and cut into slices. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a saucepan and sauté scallions, celery, and fennel for about 2-3 minutes until translucent. Add tomato paste. Pour in Noilly Prat and stock. Add mushrooms, tomatoes, and fennel seed. Simmer for about 10-15 minutes on low heat.

title: Chicken Breasts Stuffed with Spinach and Ricotta
description: Add spinach, mix and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Remove from heat, cool, coarsely chop and mix with ricotta. Add eggs and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Use a sharp knife to cut chicken breasts, forming a pocket, and stuff with ricotta mixture.

title: Morrocan Braised Lamb
description: Rinse lamb, pat dry and cut into about 4 cm (approximately 1 1/2 inch) pieces. Peel shallots and garlic. Halve shallots and cut into strips. Chop garlic finely. Season lamb with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a pan and sear meat on all sides on high heat. Add garlic, shallots, cumin, lemon zest and saffron, mix  well. Add stock. Place everything into a clay pot and cover with a lid. Place into a cold oven and turn oven temperature to 200°C (approximately 400°F), braise for about 1 1/2-2 hours.

title: Beef and Chicken Fillets with Pesto Sauce
description: Rinse the beef and chicken. Pat dry and cut into medallions. Rinse rosemary, shake dry and thread each beef medallion with a sprig of rosemary. Fry beef medallions on both sides in oil until pink on insides. Fry chicken fillets in oil on both sides until cooked through. Season both meats with salt and pepper.

title: Meatballs with Tzatziki
description: For the tzatziki: Peel the cucumber, cut in half lengthwise, remove the seeds and grate coarsely. Season with salt and let stand for about 10 minutes. Drain. Peel the remaining garlic and chop finely. Mix with the yogurt, lemon juice and cucumber and season with salt. Serve with the meatballs.

title: Arugula Salad with Caper Berries and Mushrooms
description: Toss all salad ingredients with the diced feta and the dressing and divide into bowls. Garnish with caper berries. Serve with a rich olive bread.

title: Tofu with Tomatoes
description: Rinse and clean chile peppers, cut into rings. Peel shallots and cut into rings. Peel garlic and chop finely.

title: Spinach Salad with Avocado
description: Rinse and spin dry spinach. Peel, halve and thinly slice onion. Peel avocados, halve and pit, cut into slices. Chop walnuts.

title: Potato Puree with Vinegar
description: Rinse and dry the parsley, then finely chop. Drain the potatoes, mash, and mix with the vinegar, broth, and sugar. Season to taste with the salt, pepper, and caraway seed. Mix in the oil and parsley, adjust the seasoning if necessary, and serve.

title: Pork Tenderloin with Mushrooms
description: For the pork: Rinse the meat, pat dry, season with salt and pepper and slice. Heat the oil in a large frying pan and sear the meat on all sides, around 5 minutes. Reduce the heat, cover and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until cooked to your liking. Arrange the meat over the mushrooms on serving plates and season with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with thyme.

title: Roast Pork with Sage and Apples
description: Transfer the pork to a wire rack set over a baking sheet. Increase the oven to 240°C (approximately 475°F) and roast until the rind is crispy.

title: Walnut Pesto
description: With the motor running, incorporate enough olive oil until a thick pesto has formed. Mix in the lemon juice and parmesan cheese, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
types: ['Pesto', 'Home Cooking', 'Herb', 'Nut', 'Sauce', 'Classic Sauce', 'Green pesto', 'Pesto with walnuts', 'Parsley pesto', 'low-carb']

title: Cucumber Salad with Chili
description: For the dressing, mix the oil and vinegar. Mix in the dill, then season to taste with salt and pepper. Add to the cucumbers, and marinate briefly.

title: Beef Skewers with Teriyaki Sauce
description: Place the beef in the marinade, making sure everything is covered. Chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Drain the beef, and place onto oiled wooden skewers. Place the skewers on a hot grill and cook for 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Remove from the grill and serve.

title: Parmesan Herb Baked Mushrooms
description: Rinse thyme, parsley and rosemary and shake dry. Remove leaves or needles from stems and finely chop. Melt butter in a small pan and sauté herbs in butter and mix with breadcrumbs.

title: Chicken in Herbed Garlic Butter
description: Rinse rosemary and shake dry. Peel garlic cloves and cut into sticks. Place garlic under skin of chicken legs and season with salt and pepper. Melt butter in a pan and mix with lemon juice. Place chicken legs in a baking dish, cover with rosemary sprigs and pour melted butter mixture over top. Cut lemon into thin slices and add to the baking dish. Rinse scallions and cut in half lengthwise.

title: Steamed Cod Fillets with Arugula
description: Rinse and spin dry arugula, cut out hard stems and tear into smaller pieces.
types: ['fruit-vegetable', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo dinner', 'Paleo Main Dish', 'Paleo lunch', 'baked dish', 'Fish', 'saltwater\xa0Fish', 'low-carb']

title: Marinated Salmon with Rocket
description: Rinse cilantro, shake dry, pluck leaves, and chop finely. Roughly crush coriander and mix with cilantro, ginger, sugar, and salt. Spread the herb mixture on both sides of the fish.

title: Fish Fillets with Endive and Avocado
description: Rinse endive and cut in half lengthwise. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Turkey Ragout with Braised Cucumber
description: Peel cucumber and cut in half lengthwise and scrape seeds out with a spoon. Cut cucumber into pieces and add to pan with meat. Sprinkle flour and curry powder into pan and whisk in broth. Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes.

title: Mushroom-Sage Crostini
description: Peel and finely dice the shallot and garlic.

title: Cooked Artichokes
description: Cut off the top of the come about 3 cm (approximately 1 inch). Cut the spiky tips out and remove the hay with a small spoon.

title: Watercress Soup
description: Peel and finely chop the shallot. Sweat the shallot in hot butter until translucent. Stir in the flour and saute briefly. Stir in the broth. Let simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add about 3/4 of the cress and half of the cream. Bring up to a boil. Remove from the heat and puree. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

title: Vegetable Carpaccio
description: Rinse carrots, zucchini, cucumber and kohlrabi and trim ends. Peel carrots and kohlrabi. Halve cucumbers lengthwise and scrape out the seeds with a sharp spoon. Cut the vegetables crosswise into thin slices and arrange on four dinner plates. Chop basil and parsley finely. Drizzle dressing over the vegetables and sprinkle with herbs. Cover the plate and let rest about 30 minutes.

title: Mixed Salad with Chicken
description: Rinse the lettuces, trim, remove tough stems and spin dry, then tear into smaller pieces. Rinse the radishes and thinly slice. Rinse the mushrooms and cut into thin slices. Rinse, trim and cut scallions into rings.

title: Turkey Skewer with Coconut Peanut Sauce
description: Puree the peanuts with the soy sauce, sugar and about 100 ml (approximately 1/3 cup) of coconut milk. Bring to a boil and stir in the remaining coconut milk.

title: Vegetable Stuffed Fish Roll-ups with Creamy Sauce
description: Boil reserved vegetable broth in a large pot. Place steamer over boiling broth in large pot. Cover pot and steam over medium heat for about 10 minutes. Keep finished fish rolls warm in preheated oven at 80°C (approximately 175°F). Pour vegetable broth through a sieve and reserve about 250 ml (approximately 1 cup). In a saucepan, bring broth to a boil. In a small bowl, mix 4 tablespoons cold water and starch into a paste. Stir cornstarch paste into broth, bring to a boil and cook briefly. Reduce heat and whisk in egg yolk and sour cream. Stir sauce and remove from heat. Season sauce with lemon juice, salt, and a pinch of sugar. Keep warm.

title: Stuffed Meatballs
description: Squeeze the soaked bread and knead together with the ground beef, garlic,

title: Steaks with Vegetables
description: Rinse steaks and pat dry, season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a pan and sear steaks on both sides on high heat. Add broth to the pan until meat is covered up to 1/3 and simmer for about 20 minutes on medium heat. Season steaks to taste. Arrange steaks with vegetables on plates and serve.

title: Broiled Vegetables with Garlic Aioli
description: Rinse parsley, shake dry, pluck leaves and finely chop. Peel and press the garlic. Combine the parsley with the garlic, and olive oil in a small bowl, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Place the vegetables on a serving platter, season with salt to taste, and drizzle with the parsley oil.

title: Stuffed Peppers
description: Crumble the feta with a fork. Stir in the egg and sour cream.

title: Green Vegetable Soup
description: Remove, drain well. Melt the butter for the soup in a pan and toss the vegetables in it. Cook the remaining butter until a brown foam forms, then blend together with the asparagus soup in a blender and pour through a sieve. Bring the soup to boil and stir in the cream. Place the blanched vegetables in soup bowls, pour the asparagus soup over the vegetables, garnish with chervil and mint leaves and serve.

title: Creamy Egg Salad
description: Rinse and quarter the tomatoes. Remove the seeds and finely dice.

title: Fried Cod Vegetable Skewers
description: Rinse the zucchini and cut into finger-thick slices. Rinse the bell pepper, remove the seeds, remove all white interior skins and cut into large cubes. Peel the onions and cut lengthwise into strips. Alternately thread the vegetables and the fish on 8 skewers and season with salt and pepper. Heat the remaining oil in a pan and fry the skewers for about 5-7 minutes.

title: Roast Pork
description: Mix mustard in a bowl with creme fraiche, cut cress leaves and gently fold into creme fraiche mixture.

title: Clams with Pork and Vegetables
description: Peel the carrot peel, thinly slice lengthwise and cut into small squares. Cut the cauliflower florets into small pieces.

title: Tomatoes Stuffed with Cheese with Mozzarella Salad
description: Serve with whole wheat bread, if desired.

title: Chicken Breast with Lentils
description: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Heat clarified butter in a second pan, add chicken to the pan and fry

title: Cream of Mushroom Soup
description: Add remaining butter to pan. Sauté remaining mushrooms briefly.

title: Creamy Carrot Soup
description: Cool the soup slightly, then puree with an immersion blender. Mix in the crème fraîche, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Remove the basil leaves from the stems. Rinse the basil, and pat dry. Heat the oil in a pan, and fry the basil. Remove the leaves from the oil. Garnish the soup with the basil leaves, and serve.

title: Cucumbers Stuffed with Chicken and Mushrooms
description: For the stuffed cucumbers: Rinse the cucumbers, cut in half lengthwise and scrape out the seeds. Grease a baking dish and arrange the cucumber halves in the dish, cut-side up. Fill with the chicken mixture.

title: Pike Dumplings
description: Meanwhile, rinse the spinach thoroughly, trim and blanch in boiling salted water for about 2 minutes. Shock in ice water and drain. Squeeze out excess moisture.

title: Radish Salad
description: Rinse and thinly slice the chives.

title: Arugula Salad with Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese Parcels
description: Spread over the salmon, shape into parcels and secure each with 1 chive.

title: Fish Stew
description: Heat the olive oil in a large pan and sauté the leeks until tender. Add the zucchini, peppers and garlic and season with salt and pepper. Sauté for 5 minutes. Chop the canned tomatoes coarsely and to the pan along with the juice. Simmer for 10 minutes. Rinse the fish, pat dry and cut into bite-sized pieces. Add to the pan and simmer for 3-5 minutes over low heat. Stir in the olives and season with salt and pepper. Coarsely chop the basil leaves and sprinkle over the stew before serving.

title: Salt Crusted Trout
description: Transfer to the oven to bake for about 30 minutes. Serve the fish in the salt crust with carrots and broccoli, if desired.

title: Zucchini Soup with Smoked Salmon
description: Peel the shallot and garlic, chop finely and sweat in the oil until softened. Add the grated zucchini and sauté briefly. Pour in the broth, cover and simmer for about 20 minutes. Purée the soup, stir in the cream and season with salt and pepper.

title: Grilled Lamb Chops
description: Preheat grill. Drain lamb chops and cook on the hot grill 3 minutes on each side.

title: Salmon with Salad
description: For the salad, rinse and trim the lettuce leaves, shake dry and pluck small.

title: Hearty Vegetable Gratin
description: Grease a baking dish. Alternately layer the tomato and zucchini slices in the baking dish. Slice the bologna and layer between the vegetables.

title: Mache Salad with Turkey
description: Stir together vinegar and mustard. Season with salt, pepper and apple syrup and mix in the walnut oil with a whisk. Peel garlic and squeeze through a press.

title: Fish Fillets with Zucchini Vinaigrette
description: Rinse scallions, trim and cut into thin rings. Rinse tomatoes and zucchini and finely dice. Rinse the basil, pat dry, pluck leaves and chop finely. Mix vinegar with 1 tablespoon hot water, salt and pepper. Whisk in the oil, season to taste and mix the vegetables with the vinaigrette.

title: Salmon Skewers
description: Season with pepper and showered with lemon zest.

title: Parmesan Chile Pepper Crackers
description: Using a teaspoon, create a small pile of Parmesan on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Place other piles of Parmesan on the baking sheet about 5 cm (approximately 2 inches) apart. Press each pile lightly until flattened. Spread chile pepper and fennel mixture over each pile and bake in a preheated 200°C (approximately 400°F) oven for about 4-5 minutes. Remove from the oven and store in a cool, dry place. (Can be stored for approximately 10 days in an airtight container.)

title: Pork with Grapefruit Sauce
description: Peel shallots, chop finely and sweat until translucent in 1 tablespoon butter. Deglaze with grapefruit juice, stir in cream fraiche and boil down everything to 1/3. Season with salt and pepper and stir in the chopped pistachios.

title: Poultry Meatballs
description: Mix chicken, egg, well squeezed bread, shallot, lemon zest and rosemary. Season with salt and pepper and knead to form a homogeneous dough.

title: Herbed Ricotta with Tomatoes
description: Mix the ricotta cheese with the milk.

title: Beef Pot Roast
description: Sauté vegetables in oil briefly. Place meat back in the pot. Add bay leaf, peppercorns, rosemary and thyme. Pour in the hot broth and the wine, cover and simmer 1 ½ hours at medium heat. Serve.

title: Roast Lamb with Saffron Tomato Sauce
description: Peel garlic and cut into thin slices. Blanch tomatoes for a few seconds in boiling water, rinse in cold water, peel, quarter, core and roughly cut. Chop half of parsley.

title: Baked Stuffed Tomatoes
description: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pan. Stir together and cook onions, garlic and chopped parsley. Mix in sardines and tomato flesh, bring to boil and continue to cook until the liquid has evaporated. Mix in olives and capers, season with salt and pepper and remove from heat. Brush an ovenproof dish with olive oil and put in the hollowed tomatoes alongside each other.

title: Roast Spiced Pheasant
description: Coat the pheasants with the spice mixture inside and out then brush with 1/2 of the melted butter. Preheat the oven to 220°C (approximately 425°F).

title: Herbed Pork Roulade
description: Prick the meat all around in several places with a sharp knife about 1 cm (approximately 1/2 inch) deep. Fill the small holes each with 1 pinch of spice mixture. Season the meat with salt and pepper, distribute remaining rosemary sprigs on top and firmly tie up the whole as a roast.

title: Steamed Salmon Rolls with Cream Sauce
description: Peel the carrots and cut into thin strips.

title: Pike and Char with Asparagus
description: Cut the tips off the other 1/2 of the asparagus. Set aside. Slice the asparagus stalks. Cut the celery into small cubes. Coarsely chop the walnuts. Add 1/2 the walnuts, asparagus stalks and celery to the asparagus sauce.

title: Melon with Smoked Salmon
description: Arrange melon slices and salmon on plate and garnish with freshly ground pepper and pink pepper.

title: Zucchini Frittata
description: Whisk eggs with cream, season with salt and pepper, and pour over the zucchini. Cook over low heat, covered, until set, about 8 - 10 minutes. Then invert the frittata onto a large oven-proof plate, sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, cover and bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F)for 3 - 5 minutes.  Serve warm or at room temperature.

title: Cucumbers Stuffed with Smoked Fish
description: Chop trout and salmon very finely or run through a food processor.

title: Spinach-Stuffed Fish with Asian Sauce
description: Cut fillets lengthwise, season with salt and pepper and drizzle with lemon juice.

title: Baked Salmon Fillets
description: Bake in a preheated oven (250°C, approximately 480°F, center rack) about 3 minutes. Remove and serve immediately as desired with white bread.

title: Tomato-Basil Sauce
description: Puree all the ingredients in a blender. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Mushroom Raclette
description: Peel garlic, squeeze through a press, add to a bowl and mix with oyster mushrooms. Add parsley and olive oil to the bowl, mix and season with salt and pepper. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.

title: Swiss Chard Soup
description: Heat the oil in a pot. Saute the onions and ginger. Add the chard leaves and also sauté briefly. Deglaze with broth, cover and simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

title: Radish and Arugula Salad with Feta Cheese
description: Rinse radishes, clean and cut into slices. Rinse scallions, trim and chop finely. Rinse arugula, pat dry and cut into small pieces.

title: Salmon Carpaccio with Scallops
description: For the salmon, soak seaweed in a bowl of cold water. Carefully cut salmon fillet lengthwise into a butterfly and open. Place seaweed inside salmon. Remove scallops from marinade and place in the middle of seaweed. Drizzle with pernod and season with a little sea salt. Fold salmon over scallops and roll up. Wrap salmon roll firmly in aluminum foil and rotate ends of the foil together like a candy. Freeze for approximately 4 hours.

title: Potato Cucumber Salad
description: Peel cucumber, cut in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Cut cucumber into slices. Mix broth with 1 teaspoon wheat germ oil, salt, pepper and dill. Toss potatoes with cucumber and marinade.

title: Singapore Fish Curry
description: Toast coconut chips in a dry skillet until light brown. Peel onion, garlic, ginger and lemongrass, trim and coarsely cut all. Puree onion, garlic, ginger, lemongrass, almonds and turmeric in a food processor.
