title: Vietnamese Salad with Turkey Breast
description: Rinse cabbage, remove outer leaves and core and cut into fine strips. Peel carrots, trim and cut into fine strips. Peel cucumber, cut in half, remove seeds and cut into thin strips.
types: ['Hearty Salad', 'high-fiber', 'High-fiber Appetizer', 'High-fiber Salad', 'Low-fat', 'low-fat salad', 'High-protein', 'High-protein Appetizer', 'High-protein Poultry Dish', 'High-protein Snack', 'Low-fat Appetizer', 'Fitness', 'Healthy Eating', 'Low-calorie', 'Low-calorie Appetizer', 'Low-calorie Salad', 'Low-calorie Snack', '100-250 Calorie', 'lactose-free', 'Lactose-free Poultry', 'Lactose-free Salad', 'Lactose-free Snacks', 'Light Cooking', 'low-carb', 'low-carb poultry', 'non-alcoholic', 'egg-free', 'Boneless', 'Milk-free', 'Superfoods', 'Vitamin-rich', 'whole-food', 'Garden Party', 'Low-sugar', 'skillet dish', 'Asian', 'Vietnamese', 'Spring', 'Spring Dish', 'Spring Vegetable', 'Spring Salad', 'Summer', 'Summer Salad', 'Summer Vegetable', 'Summer Dish', 'Autumn', 'Autumn snack', 'Aphrodisiac', 'Exotic', 'Meal for Four', 'crowdpleaser', 'Gourmet', 'Luxury', 'Party', 'Traveling', 'Spicy', 'Sweet', 'Sunday cooking', 'weekend cooking', 'Cooking', 'Meat', 'Poultry', 'Turkey', 'Vegetable', 'fruit-vegetable', 'Root Vegetable', 'Onion', 'Herb', 'Nut', 'Course', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'Menu', 'Appetizer', 'Side Dish', 'Side Salad', 'hearty side dish', 'Main Course']

title: Spanish Potato and Egg Tortilla
description: Whisk eggs and mix into the vegetables. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in the skillet over low heat, and pour in egg and potato mixture. Cook, shaking the pan from time to time and loosening the edges with a spatula, to prevent burning. When the bottom of tortilla is golden-brown, flip tortilla using a dinner plate. Add remaining oil to skillet, and slide tortilla back into the skillet. Continue frying on the second side until golden-brown.

title: Baked Bell Peppers with Lemon and Coriander
description: Rinse and halve peppers, remove seeds and ribs, and cut into strips. With a sharp knife, cut off peel and white pith from lemon, then cut fruit into pieces. In a mortar and pestle, coarsely crush coriander seeds. In a bowl, stir together coriander and oil. Mix in peppers and lemon pieces, season with salt and cayenne and transfer to prepared baking sheet. Bake until peppers are tender, about 15 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature, as desired.

title: Chicken Waterzooi Stew
description: Remove chicken from the pot, let cool slightly, remove skin, cut up into pieces, put aside the breast as a whole and use remaining meat elsewhere. Pour broth through a sieve and remove fat from about 600 ml (approximately 2 1/2 cups) of broth. Add chicken breasts in a hot frying pan in 1 tablespoon of hot butter and fry until golden brown and then remove from the pan again. Add remaining butter to pan. Peel onion, chop and sweat glazed in butter. Stir in flour and pour in broth while stirring. Add cream and let simmer for about 5 minutes until slightly creamy. Season with salt and pepper and puree briefly with an electric hand puree mixer (or press through a fine sieve).

title: Pea Soup
description: Meanwhile, fry the bacon until crispy in a separate pan. Drain on paper towels.

title: Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto
description: Break the parmesan cheese into pieces. Add to a blender with the lemon zest, tomato paste, garlic, tomatoes, and sunflower seeds.

title: Onion Soup
description: Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a pot, stir in the flour and pour in the soup. Add the cream and simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes. Add additional broth as needed. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from the heat and mix until frothy with the remaining butter.

title: Grilled Salmon with Spice Marinade
description: Rinse the red chile pepper, cut in half, trim, cut one half into thin strips and chop another half for garnish.

title: Trout with Spinach and Tomatoes
description: Rinse the fish, pat dry and sprinkle with lemon juice.

title: Chicken Paprika Stew
description: Brown the chicken in a hot pot in the oil. Add the onions and garlic and cook briefly. Add the paprika, chile, salt and pepper and cook briefly then deglaze with the broth. Simmer about 20 minutes quietly. Add broth as needed.

title: Turkey Breast with Tuna Sauce (Turkey Tonnato)
description: Place the eggs in a pan of cold water to cover and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat, cover and let stand 12 minutes. Drain, run under cold water and peel. Halve the eggs, remove the yolk and set aside the whites for another use. Drain the tuna. Place the egg yolks, tuna, anchovy fillets and mayonnaise in a blender. Add the lemon juice, olive oil and a little of the cooking liquid and puree until the sauce has a slightly creamy consistency. Season the tuna sauce with salt and pepper.

title: Marinated Tuna Sashimi
description: Drizzle the tuna with olive oil and lemon juice. Sprinkle with the olives, capers, chilli pepper and parsley. Season with salt, garnish with lemon wedges and fresh parsley and serve immediately.

title: Cheesy Cauliflower and Spinach Casserole
description: Rinse the cauliflower and cut into small florets. Blanch the florets in boiling, salted water for about 2 minutes. Rinse under cold water and drain well.

title: Sautéed Mullet with an Asparagus and Fruit Salad
description: Working over a bowl to catch the juice, with a paring knife, follow the curve of the oranges and remove the peel and white pith. Cut in between the membranes to release the fruit and cut into pieces. Squeeze the remaining pulp into the bowl and mix with the vinegar, 3 tablespoons oil and the sugar and season with salt and pepper to taste. Rinse the apples, quarter, core and finely chop. Add to the bowl along with the orange pieces and the asparagus and toss to combine.

title: Vegetable Topped Baked Turkey Cutlets
description: Preheat the oven to 200°C (approximately 400°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

title: Grilled Tiger Shrimp
description: For the sauce, mix the creme fraiche with the yogurt and ginger. Stir until combined, then season to taste with salt and cayenne pepper. Serve the sauce with the grilled shrimp.

title: Sliced beef with Leeks
description: Heat oil in a wok and fry beef with ginger and garlic for 1-2 minutes while stirring until browned. Add leek and a little water. With further stirring, cook for 2-3 minutes and let liquids evaporate.

title: Beef Roulades with Vegetables
description: Rinse the cilantro and pat dry with paper towels.

title: Seared Tuna with Pistachios
description: Mix pistachios with the remaining oil and the lemon juice.

title: Mushroom and Bell Pepper Skewers
description: Rinse the bell peppers, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs and cut into large pieces. Cut bacon slices in half and roll into small rolls.

title: Lamb Meatballs
description: Heat oil in a pan and fry meatballs for 5-6 minutes turning occasionally until golden brown.

title: Grilled Halloumi with Arugula
description: Drain the halloumi and slice crosswise. Mix the remaining oil with the thyme, and season with salt and pepper. Brush the sliced halloumi with the oil and thyme mixture.

title: Salmon Tartlets
description: Roll out puff pastry on a floured surface and cut out 4 circles, slightly larger than the ramekins (8 cm or 3 inched in diameter). Press pastry into greased ramekins.

title: Grilled Corn Cobs, Chicken Legs and Peppers
description: Mix 3-4 tablespoons of oil with the honey and the Worcestershire sauce and season with paprika, salt and pepper. Rub onto the chicken legs and grill for about 15 minutes until golden brown.

title: Baked Fish in Filo Pastry
description: Rinse fish fillets, pat dry, sprinkle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.

title: Peanut Sauce
description: Place the sauce in a small bowl. garnish with the parlsey, and serve.

title: Wild Garlic and Ham Strudel
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).

title: Meatballs in Caper Sauce
description: Bring the broth to a brief boil with the bay leaf and allspice berries and remove from heat. Place the meatballs in the hot broth and let stand for about 15 minutes. Remove the meatballs and pour the broth through a sieve, collecting the liquid.

title: Scotch Eggs
description: In a bowl, stir the meat with the parsley. Divide the meat mixture into 4 smooth patties.

title: Crab Patties
description: Fry the patties until golden brown for about 8 minutes from both sides in hot oil in a frying pan. Turn in between.

title: Poulard Breast with Raisin and Pine Nut Salad
description: Rinse and pat dry the poulard breast. Season with salt and pepper, and fry until golden brown in hot oil from both sides.

title: Sugar Snap Tower
description: Peel and mince garlic. Combine garlic, herbs and cheese. Season with lemon juice, salt and pepper. Pour mixture into rings, spread even and chill for at least 30 minutes.

title: Chicken with Snow Peas
description: Rinse the chicken drumsticks and pat dry. Rinse the lemon in hot water, wipe dry and strip the peel with a zester. Squeeze out the juice and add to a roasting pan with the broth. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and place skin-side up in the liquid. Peel garlic, press through a garlic press and add to the roasting pan. Brush chicken pieces with the butter, place in the oven and braise for about 20 minutes, occasionally basting with the pan juices.

title: Chicken Breasts with Spicy Oil and Vegetable Salad
description: For the salad, rinse the bell peppers, cut in half, peel with a peeler and cut into fine strips. Rinse the sugar snap peas and blanch for about 2 minutes in salted water, then rinse under cool water and drain. Rinse the scallions and cut into thin rings. Rinse and halve the tomatoes. Chop the nuts coarsely and toast in a dry pan until golden brown. Remove from pan and let cool. Mix the orange juice with the honey, then mix in all the prepared salad ingredients.

title: Ham Turkey Rolls with Savoy Cabbage and Kohlrabi
description: Heat 1 tablespoon sunflower oil in a pan and fry the onion in it until light golden brown. Add the kohlrabi and savoy cabbage and saute briefly. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg, and pour in the vegetable broth. Cover the pan and simmer for about 15 minutes over low heat.

title: Indian Chicken with Mango Sauce
description: For the sauce, peel the garlic and ginger, and finely chop. Saute together in a pan in remaining oil with the curry paste for 1-2 minutes. Add the mango chutney and 3-4 tablespoons of water. Let simmer for about 5 minutes, and season with lime juice and salt.
types: ['Chicken', 'Poultry', 'Sweet Sauce', 'Rice Side Dish', 'Tropical Fruit', 'Spices', 'Cooking on vacation', 'Asian', 'Indian', 'low-carb']

title: Monkfish Stuffed with Fresh Herbs
description: Rinse the monkfish and trim central cartilage. Cut into 2 fillets, but do not separate completely.

title: Salad with Eggs and Horseradish
description: Mix the mayonnaise with the yogurt, vinegar, and lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Drizzle the dressing over the salad, garnish with the horseradish, and serve.

title: Fish in Salt Crust
description: Wash the sea bass and pat dry. Cut the lemon into slices. Season the fish inside with some pepper and fill with the lemon slices and the basil.

title: Melon and Blue Cheese Salad with Watercress
description: For the vinaigrette: Whisk together orange juice, honey and orange zest. Season with salt and pepper. Gradually whisk in oil until emulsified. Mix together crème fraîche with cream.

title: Sausage Salad with Cheese Spread
description: In a bowl, mix the butter until light and fluffy. Add the cream cheese, diced onion and beer. Season with salt, pepper and paprika to taste. Divide between individual serving bowls and garnish with the sliced onion.

title: Salsa Dip
description: Rinse the chile peppers, pat dry and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cook under the broiler briefly and remove before they get too dark. Allow to cool, remove the seeds and ribs and finely chop.

title: Tomato Soup with Meatballs
description: For the tomato soup: Blanch the tomatoes in a pot of boiling water, rinse with cold water to cool, peel and cut into pieces.

title: Crab Cakes
description: Drain on paper towels, and serve with lemon wedges and tartar sauce.

title: Homemade Mayonnaise
description: Gather all the ingredients onto your workspace. Measure the oil, and place in a small carafe.

title: Seafood Sauce
description: Add the horseradish, lemont juice, and brandy. Season to taste with salt, worcestershire sauce, and cayenne pepper.

title: Blue Cheese Sauce
description: If you don't have an immersion blender, press the cheese through a fine strainer into a bowl. Mix in the cream, and stir until smooth. Add more liquid, to reach your desired consistency. Add the garlic, and finely chopped scallions and stir until combined.

title: Grilled Meatballs with Tomato Towers
description: For the tomato towers: Rinse the tomatoes, core and cut into 0.5 cm (approximately 1/8 inch) thin slices. Peel and slice the onions. Drain the mozzarella and cut into slices. Layer 3 tomato slices with a slice of onion and mozzarella, finishing with the mozzarella.

title: Poached Beef and Chicken with Lemon Sauce
description: Rinse the beef and chicken, and pat dry. Add the beef to the broth and simmer for 30 minutes. Add the chicken after the first 15 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat and allow the beef and chicken to poach for 25-30 minutes.

title: Deviled Eggs with Four Fillings
description: For the beet filling: Chop the beet very fine and mix into one of the bowls of chopped yolk mixture along with the sour cream and the thyme. Season to taste with horseradish and salt. Spoon this mixture into 2 eggs. Garnish thyme.

title: Herb Salad with Parsley
description: Rinse parsley, shake dry and coarsely chop leaves. Mix parsley and onion with vinaigrette and serve arranged on plates.

title: Cheese Balls on a Soccer Field
description: Finely crumble the pumpernickel. Toast the walnuts in a dry pan. Let cool and finely chop. Roll half the balls in Pumpernickel and the other half in walnuts.

title: Sesame-Crusted Pork Tenderloin with Asian Dipping Sauce
description: Rinse the pork, pat dry and trim excess fat and tendons.

title: Beef Steaks with Tomato Salsa
description: Rinse the remaining chile peppers, cut in half and remove seeds. Rinse the scallions, trim and cut in half lengthwise or quarter. Rinse steaks and pat dry. Cook steaks in a pan in the clarified butter for 4-8 minutes, depending on preference. Season with salt and pepper. Then take out of pan, wrap in aluminum foil and allow to rest.

title: Parmesan and Pine Nut Crusted Cod
description: Rinse the fish, pat dry, season with salt and pepper, drizzle with lemon juice and place skin-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush the fish with the olive paste. Mix together the breadcrumbs, pine nuts, grated parmesan, olive oil and garlic. Spread the mixture over the fish fillets and bake for 20 minutes, until golden brown.

title: Marinated Limburger
description: Dice the limburger and place in prepared jars. Rinse and dry the tomatoes, then cut in half. PLace on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Sprinkle with the powdered sugar and salt. Peel and slice the garlic. Add to the tomatoes and toss with the rosemary sprig. Dry in the oven by baking for 2 hours. Remove from the oven and let cool.

title: Layered Leek Salad with Ham
description: Peel apple, cut into quarters, remove core, cut into slices and sprinkle with lemon juice. Pour all ingredients into 4 glasses in layers: At the bottom layer some celery, then layer apple, ham, leeks, corn, eggs and slices of pineapple.

title: Meatballs on Skewers
description: Form the mixture into 8-12 small balls and place on skewers. Press well to sculpt into a slightly elongated shape. Brush with oil and grill on the preheated grill on all sides for 8-10 minutes.

title: Duck Bacon Rolls with Mushrooms
description: Heat 2 tablespoons canola oil in a pan and sear the roll slices from both sides for about 1 minute. Remove the slices from pan and place in a greased roasting tin. Bake in a preheated oven at 120°C (fan: 100°C, gas mark 1) (approximately 250°F) for about 30 minutes.

title: Lamb Meatballs with Tomatoes and Onion
description: Peel the onion and garlic and chop finely. Heat the oil in a pan, add the onion and garlic and cook until soft. Transfer to a bowl and add ground lamb, egg and chopped cilantro. Squeeze out roll, tear into pieces and add to the bowl. Knead mixture until smooth and season with salt, pepper, and chile pepper. If the mixture is too soft, knead in breadcrumbs as needed. With wet hands, shape mixture into small meatballs and place in an oiled baking dish.

title: Beef and Mushrooms
description: Clean the mushrooms and cut into slices. Rinse the scallions and cut into 4 cm (approximately 1 1/2 inches) long pieces.

title: Roast Beef Salad
description: Peel and finely dice the ginger.

title: Grilled Lamb Kabobs
description: Grill the meatballs on an oiled grill for 6-8 minutes, turning occasionally.

title: Lamb and Rosemary Skewers
description: For the marinade, zest the lemon and squeeze the juice. Mix both with the red wine, the oil, the honey, cinnamon and pepper. Pour over the lamb skewers, mix, cover and marinate overnight in the refrigerator.

title: Ground Lamb Kebabs
description: Serve with tabbouleh and grilled peppers, if desired.

title: Chicken and Shrimp Salad
description: Rinse lettuce, shake dry, chop coarsely if necessary. Peel  grapefruit and separate segments from white skin. Preserve grapefruit juice. Combine 2 tablespoons of grapefruit juice with yogurt and honey. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Baked Eggs with Ham, Noodles and Savoy Cabbage
description: Cook the soup noodles in boiling salted water for a few minutes until al dente. Drain, rinse and drain well.

title: Chorizo Halloumi Skewers
description: Brush the skewers with olive oil and cook on a grill or in a grill pan for 3-4 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Chicken Broccoli Tart
description: Cube the chicken breast. Peel and finely chop the onion and garlic. Heat the butter and oil in a pan and saute the onion and garlic. Rinse the broccoli and drain well. Add the chicken and broccoli to the pan and saute for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the parsley. Mix the eggs, cream, half of the cheese and the milk. Season with salt, pepper and curry powder. Spread the chicken-broccoli mixture in the tart tin. Pour the egg-cream mixture on top and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. Bake for about 30 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

title: Layered Salad with Onions, Egg, Bacon, Peas and Cheese
description: Layer romaine lettuce, peas, red onions, scallions, eggs, cheddar and bacon alternately in a large bowl (preferably glass). Mix mayonnaise in a bowl with buttermilk, vinegar and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Whisk well and season to taste again. Pour mayonnaise mixture over the salad and let soak for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.

title: Flans with Bell Pepper Salad
description: For the bell peppers salad, rinse, trim and quarter the bell peppers. Lay the bell pepper pieces over the baking tray with the skin side upwards and broiler in the broiler for 10-15 minutes until the skin raises black bubbles, watching carefully. Then remove and let cool covered with a damp tea towel.

title: Balls of Goat Cheese
description: Roll the third quarter of goat cheese into balls and roll in paprika. Stir remaining goat cheese with half of herbs de provence, roll mixture into small balls and roll in remaining herbs.

title: Chicken and Peanut Wontons
description: Heat oil in a wok and fry the chicken breast strips along with the garlic and the ginger for 2-3 minutes. Add the scallions, cilantro, peanuts, lemon grass, lime juice, fish sauce, soy sauce, red pepper flakes, and palm sugar, and saute briefly.

title: Creamy Sorrel Soup with Poached Eggs
description: Cook shallots in butter until translucent. Press garlic through a garlic press into the pan. Add potatoes and let steam several minutes. Add broth and wine, cover, and simmer about 20 minutes.

title: Arugula Salad with Peas and Ham
description: Rinse arugula, trim, remove rough stems, spin dry and tear into small pieces.

title: Grilled Bell Peppers with Feta Cheese
description: Place the stuffed peppers on a preheated grill and grill over medium heat until browned on all sides, about 8 minutes.

title: Fried Cod and Chorizo with Mixed Salad
description: Rinse, trim and slice ​​radishes.

title: Cauliflower and Broccoli Souffle
description: Heat butter in a saucepan, sprinkle with flour and saute until lightly browned, add cream and whisk until smooth. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.

title: Roast Chicken
description: Rinse 1 lemon in hot water, finely grate peel and then cut lemon into wedges. Mix half of lemon zest in a bowl with 1 tablespoon oil, salt and pepper and rub chicken with mixture. Stuff lemon wedges and rosemary inside chicken.

title: Rosehips in Brandy
description: Place rose hips in a carafe or jar, add apple brandy, seal and let stand for about 2 weeks. Then filter and pour into prepared bottles or jars. Tip: To preserve for longer, you will need to process the jars according to manufacturer's instructions, or visit http://nchfp.uga.edu/.

title: Mozzarella and Spinach Puff Pastry Bites
description: Rinse the spinach and blanch in a pot of boiling salted water. Remove and rinse with cold water to cool. Allow to drain and finely chop. Peel and finely chop the garlic. Heat the butter in a skillet. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the spinach and cook until just wilted. Remove from heat. Season with salt and nutmeg to taste.

title: Tomato and Mozzarella Towers
description: Drizzle 4 large slices of beefsteak tomato with a little oil and vinegar. Season with a little salt and pepper and top with a large slice of mozzarella. Layer tomatoes and cheese in a diminishing size manner and drizzle each layer with vinegar and oil, season with salt and pepper. Finish with a small plum tomato and small mozzarella ball. Secure tomato and cheese towers with wooden skewers. Garnish with basil.

title: Caesar Salad
description: Rinse the parsley and dill, shake dry, pluck and coarsely chop. Rinse the lettuce and radicchio and spin dry. Cut the radicchio into strips and mix with the herbs. Rinse and halve the tomatoes.

title: Mung Bean Salad with Beef Skewers
description: Mix all ingredients for the salad and serve with the skewers.

title: Stir-Fried Pork with Cucumbers
description: Halve cucumber lengthwise and cut into thin slices. Rinse the leeks, trim, cut in half lengthwise and cut into about 3 cm (approximately 1-inch) long pieces.

title: White Asparagus with Easy Hollandaise Sauce
description: Cook asparagus in a large pot of boiling salted water with sugar and butter for about 20 minutes.
types: ['Classic Sauce', 'low-carb', 'Mineral-rich', 'meat-free', 'Vitamin-rich', 'Classic', 'skillet dish', 'skillet vegetables', 'European', 'French', 'Spring', 'Easter', 'Mother's Day', 'Easy', 'Family', 'Vegetable', 'Sprout', 'Root Vegetable', 'Sauce', 'asparagus sauce', 'Basic Sauce', 'Cream Sauce', 'Side Dish', 'Vegetable Side Dish', 'Side Salad', 'hearty side dish']

title: Lamb Meatballs with Sesame Seeds
description: Cut the feta cheese into small cubes. With moistened hands, form meatballs with a cube of feta in the center of each. Coat in the sesame seeds and fry in oil until browned. Drain on paper towels and serve immediately.

title: Grilled Stuffed Pork Belly
description: For the filling: Puree the remaining ingredients and spoon into the cavity. Roll up the meat, cut the rind diagonally crosswise to make a diamond pattern and tie with kitchen string. Place on a spit and grill on a motorized rotisserie.

title: Grilled Spice-Rubbed Lamb Chops
description: Rinse the lime in hot water and divide into 8 wedges. Thread 1 lime wedge and 1 chop on each skewer and lightly season with salt. Cook on a hot grill for about 3-4 minutes on each side.

title: Beef and Vegetable Skewers
description: Peel onion and cut vegetables into pieces. Thread all the ingredients alternately on skewers.

title: Zucchini and Fish Salad
description: Rinse the fish fillets and season lightly with salt. Place in a small saucepan with some oil and 1 tablespoon of lemon juice. Cover and cook over low heat for 5-10 minutes, depending on thickness. Remove from the heat and allow to cool.

title: Pork Steaks on Pepper Sauerkraut
description: Cut pepper in half, rinse, remove the seeds and ribs and cut into thin strips. Saute briefly in remaining drippings. Drain sauerkraut and mix in. Pour in broth, cover and simmer 10 minutes.

title: Zombie
description: Pour drink over ice cubes in glass. Garnish with cocktail cherries and orange peel.

title: Salmon Tartare with Cucumber Dressing
description: Whisk olive oil with mustard, vinegar and orange juice. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Salad with Avocado Cream and Smoked Mackerel
description: Peel avocado, remove core and puree with lemon juice and cream. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Toast with Ham and Scrambled Eggs
description: Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a pan, pour in egg mixture, cook and then stir quickly.

title: Leaf Salad with Fried Scallops
description: Cut scallops in half crosswise, sprinkle with lemon juice and season lightly with salt and pepper.

title: Fontina Cheese Sauce
description: Increase the temperature. Add 1 egg yolk, and continue stirring until the mixture is completely smooth. Repeat this process with the remaining egg yolk. Season to taste with pepper. This sauce goes well served with pasta.

title: Duck Breast on Arugula Salad
description: Lay duck breasts skin-side down in a hot pan and cook over medium heat for about 8 minutes, then turn and cook for another 8 minutes and season with salt and pepper. Remove duck from the pan, wrap in aluminum foil and let rest.

title: Mini Tomato, Egg and Meatball Skewers
description: Peel eggs. To serve, thread one quail egg, one tomato and a meatball on each skewer.

title: Yogurt-Lemon Dip
description: Mix in the yogurt, lemon juice, lemon zest, and sour cream. Season to taste and serve.

title: Avocado Sauce
description: Peel the garlic, and pass through a press into the bowl. Mix in the egg yolks, and season to taste with salt and lemon juice. Gradually incorporate the oil in a thin stream, mixing constantly. Mix enough oil until a thick and creamy sauce forms. Season the sauce with salt and pepper and serve.

title: Arugula and Basil Salad with Mozzarella
description: Season the vinegar with salt and pepper, then drizzle over the mozzarella. Drizzle the plates with the olive oil, garnish with basil leaves, and serve.

title: Lamb Chops with Eggplant and Tomatoes
description: Blanch eggplant cubes in boiling water 2-3 minutes. Drain, rinse and pat dry. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan and cook the eggplant in portions, then remove from the pan.

title: Smoked Salmon and Cream
description: Cut the smoked salmon into rectangles 5 x 6 cm (approximately 2 x 2 1/2-inches). Cut the sections into smaller cubes and transfer to a heatproof bowl. Add the creme fraiche, chives and lemon juice and season with salt, and pepper.

title: Arugula-Potato Pizza
description: Clean mushrooms and cut into slices.

title: Tarragon Vinaigrette
description: Add the tarragon leaves, to taste, and serve.

title: Marinated Turkey Salad
description: Rinse radishes, trim and slice.

title: Cod-Chard Casserole
description: Sauté stems in oil briefly, cover and braise until al dente, 5-10 minutes. Add leaves, season with salt and cayenne pepper and cook 1 more minute. Allow everything to cool. Preheat the oven to 225°C (approximately 425°F). Add the chard to an oiled baking dish.

title: Capon
description: Place the capon on a wire roasting rack on top of the roasting pan and brush with melted butter. Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 375°F) for 50 minutes, basting during cooking with butter. Remove the capon from the rack. Pour the pan juices into a saucepan with the vegetables and boil down a little to make a rich sauce. Strain through a sieve and keep warm.

title: Lobster with Butter
description: Heat the butter, skimming the foam and pour into bowl. Cut the lemon into slices. Remove the lobster from the water and serve with the clarified butter and lemon wedges.

title: Crayfish and Vegetable Salad
description: Remove the tail and claws from the body, remove the tail meat from the shell and remove the intestine using a sharp knife.

title: Chicken and Vegetable Pan
description: Cut chicken breasts across the grain into strips. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Tomato Salad with Halloumi Cheese
description: Drain the halloumi and cut into slices. Grill for 3 minutes on each side.

title: Meatballs with Vegetable Rice
description: For the meatballs: Soak the toast in lukewarm water to soften, squueze dry. Peel and finely chop the shallot and sauté in the butter until translucent. Place in a bowl and mix well with ground meat, egg and bread. If the ground is too soft to shape, add the breadcrumbs until it is easy to shape. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. With wet hands form small balls.

title: Meatballs in Herb Sauce
description: For the sauce, peel the shallot and chop finely. Melt butter in a pan, add shallot and cook until translucent. Sprinkle with the flour and pour in the wine, stirring constantly. Bring to a boil and stir in the cream, stirring constantly. Simmer until slightly creamy while stirring, 3-4 minutes. Finally, add the parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve with the meatballs.

title: Tofu with Vegetables
description: In the meantime, rinse snow peas and remove strings if necessary. Rinse chile pepper, trim and chop. Cut the tofu into cubes.

title: Omelet with Chicken Filling
description: Rinse the scallions and cut into rings. Rinse the chicken, pat dry, and chop into small pieces. Clean and slice the mushrooms. Rinse the chile pepper, halve, seed, and cut into fine strips. Sauté the chicken with the chile pepper in 1 tablespoon hot oil until golden brown. Add the scallions and mushrooms and sauté briefly. Remove from heat and mix with the rice. Keep covered.

title: Red Snapper with Vegetables
description: Rinse the fennel, cut in half, remove the hard stalk and cut the halves into fine slices. Peel garlic and ginger and cut into slices. Fry garlic and ginger along with the fennel in a pan in 2 tablespoons hot oil until golden brown, 5-6 minutes. Sprinkle in the thyme and season it with salt and pepper.

title: Oysters Au Gratin
description: Preheat the oven broiler.

title: Sweet Peppermint Martini
description: Strain the cocktail into a well-chilled martini glass. Garnish with a peppermint, and serve.

title: Fish Stock

Cook the onions for 4-5 minutes. Serve both on plates and top with the pieces of pepper with the dressing. Serve garnished with arugula.

description: Finally, stir in dill and season with salt, lemon juice and pepper.

title: Vegetable Frittata

Sauté bell peppers with the onion in hot oil in a non-stick, ovenproof pan for 3-4 minutes. Add zucchini and cook briefly. Whisk the eggs with the cream and cheese, season with salt, pepper, paprika and chile pepper and pour over the vegetables. Cook briefly until thickened, then transfer to the oven and bake about 15 minutes.

title: Creamy Custard
description: Strain through a sieve and serve hot or cold as desired.

description: Squeeze juice from lemon.

title: Breaded Cutlets with Potatoes
description: Serve with sweet mustard and potatoes.

title: Baked Crayfish Meatballs
description: Heat the oil in a pan and cook the meatballs while turning for 3-5 minutes until crispy. Then lift out with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Mix the mayonnaise with the wasabi paste and lime juice to taste.

title: Spicy Baked Chicken Drumsticks
description: Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Rinse and par dry chicken legs. Loosen skin and spread sauce directly on meat, pull skin back as well as possible. Arrange chicken on baking sheet and bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for abour 25 minutes. Baste with the sauce often. Arrange chicken on plates and serve accompanied by remaining sauce.

title: Puff Pastry Slices with Ham and Arugula
description: Roll out puff pastry and cut into half lengthwise. Whisk egg yolk with cream, brush pastry with the mixture. Cut into 3-4 cm (approximately 1-1 1/2 inch) wide strips and place on a lined with parchment paper baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 10-15 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Beef Steaks with Chanterelle Sauce
description: Rinse meat, pat dry, season with salt and pepper. Heat butter in a pan and brown meat for about 1-2 minutes per side. Remove from oven and wrap in aluminum foil, let rest.

title: Peas with Spicy Mascarpone Cream
description: Separate eggs. Beat egg whites in a bowl until stiff with a pinch of salt. Whisk egg yolks in a bowl with Parmesan and mascarpone until smooth. Fold egg whites into egg yolk mixture and season with salt and pepper.

title: Hearty Kale Pie
description: Preheat the oven to 200°C (approximately 375°F) top and bottom heat. Butter a tart pan.

title: Summer Squash Frittata
description: Cut ciabatta into cubes. In a pot or ovenproof skillet, fry bread cubes in melted butter until golden-brown. Remove from pan. Rinse, trim and cut summer squash into small cubes. Rinse herbs, shake dry, strip leaves from stems and chop. Peel and finely dice shallot and garlic. Heat olive oil in the pan. Add shallot and garlic and cook until translucent. Add herbs and summer squash and fry briefly. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in toasted bread cubes.

title: Pretzel Crusted Pork Cutlets
description: Press the cutlets firmly in the pretzel crumbs, covering all sides. Cook the cutlets in the clarified butter about 4 minutes on each side.

title: Turkey Cordon Bleu
description: To prepare the cordon bleus, top each turkey cutlet with one ham slice and one blue cheese slice. Roll up the turkey cutlets and fix, such as with toothpicks. Season the rolls on outside with salt and pepper, and coat with flour. Beat the egg with the milk, and dip the rolls in it. Finally, coat the rolls in the breadcrumbs and press gently.

title: Crispy Fried Turkey
description: Heat butter in a large frying pan and fry turkey until golden yellow, about 4 minutes. Remove and drain on paper towels.

title: Matcha Tea Latte
description: Then pour the hot (about 80°-90°C, approximately 175°-190°F) water into the Matcha paste and stir vigorously with a fork (or a whisk). Divide the tea between four glasses and froth the hot milk.

title: Salad with Avocado, Sausages and Mushrooms
description: Arrange all salad ingredients on plates.

title: Niçoise Salad
description: Rinse and shake dry (or spin dry) lettuce, tear leaves into smaller pieces. Drain olives, tuna and capers. Cut olives into rings and mix tuna with mayonnaise.

title: Mixed Salad with Cucumber and Salmon
description: Prepare dressing in a sealable jar. Shake together orange juice, sweet chili sauce, remaining oil and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Serve salad drizzled with the dressing as needed.

title: Tomato-Mozzarella Salad
description: For the dressing, mix the baslamic vinegar with the oil, oregano, and sugar. Season to taste with salt and red pepper. Drizzle over the salad and serve.

title: Squid Salad
description: Combine lemon zest, juice and leaves in a large bowl. Add olives, capers, orange juice and 4 tablespoons of olive oil and whisk well. Heat remaining oil in a pan and cook squid rings for about 1 minute.

title: Grilled Shrimp
description: Remove the shrimp from the marinade and place on a hot grill. Turn occasionally, cooking 7-9 minutes total. Serve with a sauce like an aioli and a fresh baguette.

title: Spinach Quiche
description: Preheat the convection oven to 200°C (approximately 400°F). Butter the quiche pan.

title: Asparagus Cream Soup with Fish
description: Thaw the peas. Peel the shallot and garlic and finely chop. Heat the butter and 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a saucepan and sauté the shallots and garlic. Add the peas and asparagus and deglaze with the white wine. Pour in the vegetable stock, season with salt, cover and cook for 10-15 minutes until the vegetables are soft.

title: Spinach and Cilantro Soup with Cheese Skewers
description: Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a pot. Add the onion and garlic, and cook until translucent. Add the spinach, cilantro and both and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 10 minutes. Puree the soup until smooth and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg to taste. Season with the cumin and curry.
types: ['Spices', 'American', 'Latin America', 'Central America', 'Mexican', 'In a jar', 'Cooking on vacation', 'soup', 'low-carb']

title: Grilled Steaks with Savoy Cabbage
description: Remove the outer leaves from the cabbage, quarter, remove the core and cut into thin strips.

title: Buffalo Steaks
description: Remove the steaks from the bowl and set the marinade aside. Sear the steaks on the grill for about 2 minutes on each side over high heat. Then place under the broiler for another 4-6 minutes depending on the desired degree of doneness. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Asparagus Tart with Salmon
description: For the topping: rinse and dry asparagus, peel botoom thirds and blanch asparagus in boiling salted water for about 4 minutes. Drain and rinse in cold water, drain again. Rinse salmon, pat dry and cut into small pieces.
types: ['Savory Tarts', 'asparagus cake', 'vegetable tart', 'Quiche', 'Flan', 'tart', 'asparagus tart', 'non-alcoholic', 'Pescetarian', 'Spring Vegetable', 'Spring Cake', 'Fish', 'Vegetable', 'Sprout', 'Lunch', 'Dinner', 'low-carb']

title: Roasted Leg of Lamb
description: Preheat the oven to 220°C (approximately 430°F). Place the lamb in a roasting pan, and place in the oven. Roast for 30 minutes, then pour the white wine over the lamb. Continue to roast, turning after 1 hour.  Roast for 1 for 1 1/2 hours, until the lamb is pink on the inside. Remove from the oven, wrap in aluminum foil, and rest for 15 minutes.

title: Trout and Sauteed Vegetables
description: Blanch tomatoes in boiling water, rinse with cold water, peel, remove seeds and dice. Peel and chop carrots and soup vegetables. Heat olive oil in a large frying pan, sauté garlic and add vegetables and parsley. Push vegetables to the side to make roo to cook trout.

title: Sausage Salad
description: Combine the sausages, onion, gherkin and cheese in a large bowl. Whisk together the vinegar, oil, mustard, salt and pepper. Drizzle over the salad and toss until everything is well coated. Transfer to a serving platter lined with lettuce and garnish with chopped chives.

title: Tomato Ragout
description: Heat half of the butter in a pan. Add the tomatoes, and sauté for 5 minutes. Rinse and chiffonade the basil, then mix into the potatoes.

title: Grilled Marinated Chicken Wings
description: Serve with reserved marinade for dipping.

title: Carp with Spinach, Rutabaga Soufflé and Potato Sauce
description: Beat the egg whites with salt until stiff.

title: Oatmeal Chocolate Rum Balls
description: Stir in oatmeal, cocoa powder, rum and almond extract and beat at the highest speed, until the mixture is creamy. Shape into small balls, roll in granulated sugar, and allow to dry overnight.

title: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Tomato Sauce
description: Sauté onion in butter, press in garlic, add the ground meat and fry until crumbly. Season with salt and pepper, remove from heat and let cool.

title: Deep-fried Bulgur Rolls with Lamb and Spices
description: Mix the bulgur with the same amount of warm water in a bowl and let sit for about 15 minutes. Stir in the remaining ground lamb, season with salt and knead well. Divide into 12 portions and form into circles. Place some of the filling in a strip down the center and gather the bulgur up around the sides, pressing to seal and forming an elongated, tapered dumpling shape.

title: Baked Ratatouille
description: Heat oil in a pan and lightly saute the eggplant on both sides. Rinse the tomatoes and cut into circles. Layer the vegetables in a gratin dish in an alternating pattern. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Roasted Chicken with Herbs and Lemon
description: Preheat the oven to 220°C (approximately 425°F). Meanwhile, truss chicken: Fold wings under chicken and tie legs together with kitchen string.

title: Cream Cheese Soup with Corn and Carrots
description: Boil the broth, add the carrot strips and simmer for 3 minutes. Pour in the cream and bring to a boil again.

title: Leg of Lamb with Mint Sauce
description: Fry on all sides in some butter and then distribute the shallots around the meat. Fry for a short while and then transfer to a roasting pan. Pour in the wine and cook, covered, in a pre-heated oven at 200°C (approximately 400ºF) for 60 minutes.

title: Beef Goulash with Bell Peppers
description: Pour all the meat into the saucepan, add onions and garlic and sprinkle with paprika. Season with salt, pepper and caraway seeds. Stir in tomato paste.

title: Chicken Breast with Spanish Ham
description: Pluck the leaves from 1/2 the thyme sprig and bring to a boil in the wine. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Pour over the chicken and toss to combine. Garnish with the remaining thyme and serve with crusty bread, if desired.

title: Marinated Vegetables
description: For the zucchini: Rinse the zucchini, pat dry, trim, quarter lengthwise and then cut in half crosswise. Dust in flour, shaking off the excess, and sauté in olive oil until golden brown. Transfer to a shallow serving bowl. Add the red wine vinegar to the hot oil, bring to a boil then pour over the zucchini. Sprinkle with rosemary and tarragon and season with salt and pepper.

title: Fried Scallops with Mixed Green Salad
description: Sprinkle scallop meat with lemon juice and season lightly with salt and pepper.

title: Chicken Legs with Zucchini and Wild Rice
description: Heat some oil in a wok and fry the chicken legs in portions for 2 minutes. Remove and drain.

title: Fish and Crab Fritters with Pepper Sauce
description: Peel the garlic and finely chop.

title: Meatballs Stuffed with Feta Cheese
description: Garnish meatballs with lettuce leaves and serve with mustard, if desired.

title: Ground Beef and Savoy Cabbage Strudel
description: For the sauce: whisk egg yolks with wine over hot water bath until foamy. Slowly add melted butter and whisk until sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Serve strudel with sauce.

title: Beef Tartare with Scallions and Horseradish
description: Transfer the tartare to a shallow dish and make a well in the middle. Add the oil, horseradish, scallion, soy sauce, lemon juice, parsley and mash with a fork until combined. Season with salt, pepper, cayenne and paprika.

title: Mini Potato Pizzas with Tuna and Mozzarella
description: Cut mozzarella into slices.

title: Baked Chicken and Vegetables
description: Cut bell pepperin half, remove seeds, rinse and cut into eighths. Rinse zucchini and cut into large pieces. Blanch tomatoes in boiling water, rinse with cold water, peel, quarter and remove seeds.

title: Grilled Pork Ribs
description: Serve these ribs alongside a salad, bread rolls, cooked vegetables, beans, etc. for a more complete meal.

title: Salad with Smoked Salmon and Cream Cheese Rolls
description: Whisk 2 tablespoons lemon juice with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Stir in 1 tablespoon chopped chives and pour over asparagus. Let marinate about 20 minutes.

title: Seafood Vegetable Casserole
description: Cook shallot in butter until translucent. Press in the garlic and add carrot and celery. Deglaze with some water and simmer for about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Trout with Parmesan Crust and Stuffed Tomato
description: Rinse herbs, shake dry and chop finely. Peel garlic.

title: Pancakes with Spinach
description: Mix eggs in another bowl with remaining soy sauce, sugar, fish stock and remaining rice wine. Heat oil in a pan, add 1/4 of egg mixture and let thicken over medium heat. Egg mixture should still be slightly damp when cooked. Slip pancake out of the pan onto a board and repeat process with remaining egg mixture.

title: Asian Chicken
description: Mix garlic in a bowl with lemongrass leaves, coriander root, fish sauce and soy sauce and season to taste with salt, pepper and chili sauce. Rinse chicken, pat dry and brush with soy sauce mixture. Let chicken rest for 1 hour and then brush again with soy sauce mixture.

title: Squid and Pepper Salad
description: Toss the squid with the vegetables, sprinkle with oregano and let rest for 30 minutes before serving.

title: Trout with Mushrooms
description: Season fish with salt and pepper, place in a steamer basket or on a plate, on which it can be steamed. Sprinkle trout with 1 tablespoon rice wine.

title: White Asparagus with Herb Oil
description: Rinse and dry the herbs. Remove the leaves from the stems, then finely chop. Mix with the olive oil, remaining lemon juice, and the zest from half of a lemon. Mix until smooth, then season to taste with salt and pepper.
types: ['Vegetable', 'Paleo Diet', 'Paleo Side Dish', 'Sprout', 'Herb', 'asparagus sauce', 'Side Dish', 'Vegetable Side Dish', 'low-carb']

title: Beef Stock
description: Rinse, peel, and coarsely chop the carrots and celery root.. Add the vegetables and peppercorns to the bone mixture. Have the leek and tie together with the bay leaves and thyme and add as well.

title: Marinated Goat Cheese
description: Rinse and dry the basil, rosemary, and parsley. Remove the leaves from the herbs. Rinse the pepper, remove the seeds, and julienne. Coarsely chop the peppercorns.

title: Duck with Wine Sauce
description: Rinse and par dry Muscovy ducks inside and out, season with salt and pepper inside and out. Rinse marjoram and stuff each duck with half of bunch. Arrange ducks in a large roasting pan and roast in preheated oven at 220°C (approximately 425°F) for about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and cut off breasts, slice breasts thinly and keep warm. Reduce oven temperature to 200°C (approximately 400°F) and roast the rest of ducks for 30 more minutes. Peel shallots and chop finely. Heat butter in a pan and saute shallots until soft. Add wine and reduce in half. Season with salt and pepper, cut cold butter into pieces and add to the sauce, whisking. Arrange sliced duck breasts on plates and drizzle with sauce. Serve accompanied by celery puree.

title: Red Cabbage Salad
description: Cut bell pepper in half, remove the seeds, rinse and cut into strips. Peel onion, halve and cut into thin rings. Trim mache, rinse and drain well.

title: Chinese Pasta Soup with Crayfish
description: Peel the shallots, chop finely and saute in a pan in 1 tablespoon hot butter with crushed garlic. Stir in the vermouth and fish stock, bring to a boil, add the Chinese pasta and cook for about 5 minutes. Stir in the cilantro and lime juice, and season with salt and pepper.

title: Baked Whole Red Mullet
description: Cut the onions into rings and sauté in oil until translucent. Spread onions with the bay leaves in the fish cavities. Rinse lemon and cut into thin slices.

title: Halibut with Vegetables
description: Rinse bell pepper, trim, cut in half, remove seeds, remove ribs and dice.

title: Chicken Wrapped Vegetables
description: Cut vegetables into 4 cm (approximately 1.5 inch

title: Fish Mousse on Salad
description: Rinse the endive, dry, tear into bite-sized pieces.

title: Almond Crusted Tofu
description: Rinse the lettuce and radicchio and pat dry. Rinse and halve the cherry tomatoes. Whisk together the white wine vinegar and olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Arrange the lettuce and tomatoes onto a serving plate and drizzle with the dressing.

title: Hare Fillet on a Bed of Salad
description: Rub the hare fillet with salt and pepper and brown on all sides in hot oil for 5 minutes. Deglaze with Madeira, let boil, remove the pan from the heat and seal in foil. Combine mustard, salt, vinegars, wine and oil for a vinaigrette and mix with two-thirds of salad leaves and spread on four plates. Garnish with pears, beans and mushrooms. Cut fillet of hare into thin slices and distribute. To serve, mix the remaining vinaigrette with the gravy and drizzle over the salad, garnish with walnuts.

title: Herb Cheese with Cucumber and Egg
description: Mix everything with the quark and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a glass jar.

title: Grilled T-Bone Steak
description: Preheat the grill. Grind the dried chilli pepper (if using) in a mortar until finely ground. Remove the needles from one of the rosemary sprigs and chop finely. Whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, minced garlic, chilli pepper, rosemary, salt and pepper. Pound the steak with a meat tenderizer and place on the grill.

title: Wild Boar Steaks
description: The next day, remove meat, pat dry, flatten slightly and season with salt and pepper. Pour marinade through a sieve. Heat butter and oil in a pan and fry steaks on both sides for 4 minutes. Wrap in aluminum foil and let rest for 10 minutes. To make gravy, pour marinade in a saucepan and simmer over high heat. Place steaks again briefly in the pan and serve with sauce on plates.

title: Salmon with Brussels Sprouts
description: Heat butter in a pan with the bacon fat drippings and fry the salmon fillets on both sides for about 4 minutes. Distribute among plates with Brussels sprouts and croquettes. Sprinkle the salmon with freshly ground pepper and serve.

title: Stuffed Roast Lamb
description: Meanwhile, peel potatoes, rinse, cover with water and cook for about 20 minutes, drain and allow to evaporate.

title: Mixed Green Salad with Avocado and Walnuts
description: Halve the avocados, remove the pits, peel, cut into slices and sprinkle with lemon juice immediately.

title: Sea Bream with Limes, Tomatoes and Scallions
description: Trim the scallions, rinse and chop. Peel 5 garlic cloves and mince. In a wide pot, heat 3 tablespoons oil, add the parsley, scallions, thyme and garlic and cook briefly. Add the tomatoes and simmer over low heat for 2 minutes.

title: Corn Cakes with Smoked Salmon and Roe
description: Heat clarified butter in a pan. In batches, fry corn cakes until golden, about 2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Divide corn cakes among plates.

title: Meatball and Zucchini Skewers
description: Mix together remaining flour and paprika in a deep dish. Form meat mixture into small meatballs and dredge in flour mixture.

title: Sauteed Endive Salad
description: For the salad: Cut endives in half lengthwise, then cut out stalk. Divide endive leaves. Rinse nectarines, pat dry, cut in half, remove core and julienne.

title: Grilled Beef Fillet with Tomatoes
description: Take meat out of refrigerator 2 hours before you plan to serve it. Drain well, pouring the marinade through a sieve. Truss meat with kitchen twine, place in a grill pan, distribute collected onions and garlic over the meat and sear on the preheated grill 1 minute. Slide grill pan to the side and cook covered for 15 minutes on indirect heat.

title: Omelet with Goat Cheese
description: Heat the butter in a pan, then add the egg-cheese mixture. Let set, covered, over low heat. Garnish with the whole basil leaves before serving.

title: Broiled Cheesesteaks
description: Rinse and coarsely chop cilantro. Mix into onions. Puree mixture with an immersion blender. Season with lemon juice and salt. Rinse steaks, pat dry and season with pepper.

title: Pepper Frittata
description: Heat butter in a pan and saute onion and peppers until softened, add eggs and cream, season with salt and pepper and cook until golden.

title: Baked Cod with Vegetable Curry
description: Add vegetables to the pan and season with salt, pepper and curry powder. Add cream, bring to a boil and pour everything into a deep baking dish. Rinse cod, pat dry and season with salt, pepper and sprinkle with lemon juice. Place cod on top of vegetables.

title: Grilled Tuna with Mache Salad
description: Trim mache, rinse and spin dry. Cut zucchini into fine strips and combine with halved cherry tomatoes and artichokes. For the dressing, whisk egg yolks with salt and pepper to taste and whisk in the oil drop-by-drop until mixture is thick. Dice the cucumber finely, fold into the sauce and season with lemon juice. Cut fish into slices. Arrange tuna slices on plates with mache, tomatoes, zucchini and artichokes and drizzle with the dressing. Coarsely chop the pistachios and sprinkle on top.

title: Beef Consomme with Scallops
description: In a bowl, beat the egg whites until very stiff. Gently fold into the beef broth. Stir the broth until the egg white mixture and meat forms a raft on top of the soup. Stop stirring.

title: Savoy Cabbage Rolls
description: Rinse and dry scallions and carrot, chop. Peel apple and quarter, core and cut into strips, sprinkle with lemon juice. Rinse and shake dry parsley, chop. Toast pine nuts in a dry pan and set aside. Combine yogurt with mustard and parsley, season with salt and pepper.

title: Mediterranean Zucchini Salad
description: Trim scallions, rinse, cut off ends and cut into thin rings. Mix all prepared ingredients with the olives.
